alimentation . manger local.description:
Local food allows us to reduce the transport distances of the products
we consume. However, even if it may seem counter-intuitive, local food
can, depending on the case, be unfavorable in terms of greenhouse gas
emissions: the impact of the origin of our products cannot be summed up
in a comparison between short and long distance. The effects of scale,
the centralization of products, the efficiency of the transport used (or
conversely the lack of efficiency) make the matter more complex from a
carbon accounting point of view.

Nevertheless, local food has many other positive impacts, first of all
by supporting the farmers of our regions!

It is important to keep in mind that this is a first approach that will
be refined later on. As an example, we can suppose that the impact of
this action will be more important for vegetalized diets, which is not
taken into account here.

alimentation . manger de saison.description:
Contrary to what one might imagine, the impact of this action is
relatively low because the share of seasonal products is very low in the
average French person's diet.

But there are many other benefits to seasonal food such as the lower
consumption of water, the diversity of crops, or the lower dependence on
hydrocarbons (gas and oil) that heat the greenhouses.

It is important to keep in mind that this is a first approach that will
be refined later on. As an example, we can suppose that the impact of
this action will be more important for vegetated systems, which is not
taken into account here.
alimentation . manger de saison.note: To learn more about the calculation method, browse its formula, the variables will be explained.

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description:
Bottled water has an environmental impact 450 times greater than tap water. It costs between 100 and 300 times more (80% of the price comes from the
production of the packaging) and is a major contributor to plastic pollution of the oceans.

> Our plastic waste is often sold to other countries. In 2016, no less than 50% of sorted European plastic waste was exported to China.
alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.note: Sources: √âcobilan de l'eau potable and Minist√®re de la Transition Ecologique p106

d√©passe: alimentation . d√©chets . avoir un stop pub

alimentation . d√©chets . devenir z√©ro.description: Becoming 'zero waste' is particularly challenging: tracking down the smallest item of packaging requires constant attention. > You should be aware that in the case of a 'zero waste' commitment, we are still considering emissions of greenhouse gases (albeit considerably reduced), as it is very difficult, if not impossible, to generate no waste at all, some of which is invisible and unavoidable it is very difficult, if not impossible, to generate zero waste, some of which is invisible and unavoidable. To find out more about zero waste lifestyles, visit the Zero Waste Franceswebsite

alimentation . d√©chets . r√©duire gaspi.description:
In France, the average food waste is estimated at 30 kg per person per
year, including 7 kg of food still wrapped!

If we take a step back and consider the entire value chain (i.e. from
the field to the plate) it is about 10 million tons of food that are
wasted per year, or 150 kg per capita.

Reducing food waste is therefore essential in order to avoid producing
to throw away!

You will find useful tips and practices
[here](https://agirpourlatransition.ademe.fr/particuliers/conso/alimentation/pourquoi-gaspillons-autant-nourriture)

alimentation . d√©chets . composter.description:
Our bio-waste, i.e. the putrescible waste from our food (peelings,
leftovers, etc.), represents a large part of the weight of our grey
garbage can, thus contributing to increase the carbon footprint
associated with waste management. This waste is very often little or
poorly recycled despite the environmental benefit it can bring: compost,
a rich organic substance that is beneficial to the soil. Composting our
biowaste (individually or collectively) allows us to reduce the size of
our garbage cans and to encourage the creation of compost that can
eventually be used as an alternative to chemical fertilizers.

une de ces conditions: alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . stop pub . pr√©sent

alimentation . d√©chets . avoir un stop.description:
This is a sticker you place on your letterbox to inform advertising distributors that you refuse to receive catalogues, promotions, restaurant menus and all kinds of advertising.

This does not prevent all advertising, but it sends out a strong signal and generally considerably reduces the amount of paper waste received.

divers . partage NGC.description:
In addition to the actions you can take, talking about this simulator to your friends, your colleagues, sharing it on social networks, etc. is also a strong way to contribute to the reduction of CO‚ÇÇ emissions!

It's certainly a very small digital impact in addition (well less than 1kgCO‚ÇÇe, well unless you're a big network star ü§© !), but it's especially potentially a lot of impact in terms of change! üìâ
If these people decide on the same actions as you, imagine the multiplier effect! üôå

divers . aider les autres.description:
There comes a time when gaining weight becomes very complicated

If your footprint falls below 4 tons, or if certain constraints make your progress impossible, you're probably better off helping others reduce their footprint than torturing yourself over yours

How can you do this? By distributing this simulator, by discussing these topics with your friends and family, by leading workshops in your company or association, or even by helping someone to change one of their polluting habits.

divers . publicit√©.description:
Through the desires they create in us, advertising and marketing incite us to overconsumption and early renewal of our equipment. These promotions serve to maximize the renewal rate and the volume of goods sold, volumes that are often disproportionate to the real demand. Not renewing our appliances and equipment too early and making them last as long as possible is a strong gesture for the climate. > For example: > Not renewing your smartphone too early (after 2 years) saves 16 kgCO2eq > For a television (4 years) it is 170 kgCO2eq avoided If urban advertising (bus stops, giant billboards, supermarkets) is complicated to ignore, note that it is easy to get rid of it **on the Web** with an extension to install in 1 click in your browser. **On mobile**, it depends on your device:
On iPhoneTheiOS ecosystem is padlocked by Apple, so there's not much you can do.
On AndroidYoucan use Firefox and install the muBlock extension, or another browser from the app store that allows blocking (Chrome does not). For applications, it is more complicated, but it is possible to install alternative applications without ads (for example Youtube Vanced or New Pipe as a replacement for the Youtube application) or to install a blocker for all applications (for example Blokada).

Increasing the lifespan of your household appliances (by taking care of them or repairing them when they break down) allows you to limit your impact
on the climate

Renewing equipment prematurely, on the other hand, contributes to producing more equipment for the same service.

If you absolutely want to get rid of an object prematurely, think of the ressourceries or recycleries, for example, which are places dedicated to reuse! üòâ

Limiting its consumption, in this case by one hour per day when you spend more than 2 hours on it, and favouring alternatives such as reading, allows you to reduce your digital carbon footprint.

divers . textile . r√©duire neuf . achet.description:
Buying new clothes has a huge impact on our carbon footprint. Worldwide, it is estimated that the textile industry is responsible for 10% of global greenhouse gas emissions.

It's time to rethink our relationship with our wardrobe! Own less, choose quality clothes that can be repaired and buy second-hand.

divers . textile . r√©duire neuf . divis.applicable si: divers . textile . nombre de textiles achet√©s > 10
divers . textile . r√©duire neuf . divis.description: Did you know? A study has shown that, on average, the French don't touch 68% of their wardrobe each year. We own too many clothes! Let's buy less, and think about giving new life to what's lying around in our cupboards.

divers . produits consommables . r√©duir.titre: Reduce your consumption of hygiene products
divers . produits consommables . r√©duir.description: There are many eco-friendly alternatives to industrial hygiene products. As well as being less harmful to you and the environment, they also reduce the amount of resources used for personal and household hygiene.

divers . autres produits . r√©duire.description: Favouring second-hand cars in all circumstances means avoiding a lot of CO2 emissions.

divers . arr√™ter sport motoris√©.description:
To date, the footprint of motorised sports is based on very strong assumptions that do not reflect the regular practice of a motorised sport.
But it is obviously significant! The gain is therefore greater than what is shown here.

logement . baisse temp√©rature.description:
Housing and in particular its heating (oil or gas) has a significant
impact on the climate.

Lowering the temperature by one or two degrees can be a way to reduce
its footprint.

Source : ADEME - [40 tips and tricks to save water and
energy](https://www.ademe.fr/40-trucs-astuces-economiser-leau-lenergie)
logement . baisse temp√©rature.formule: (nombre degr√©s * gains 1 degr√© * empreinte chauffage air) / habitants

logement . baisse temp√©rature . nombre.question: How many degrees would you be willing to lower the temperature in your home?
logement . baisse temp√©rature . nombre.description:
¬æ of a household's energy consumption is spent on heating and hot water.

This energy consumption, in addition to having a significant financial
cost, increases the carbon footprint of households.

However, it can easily be limited by lowering the temperature of the
occupied rooms without losing thermal comfort or feeling cold (provided
that the dwellings are well insulated).

For example, set the temperature between 19¬∞ and 21¬∞C in occupied rooms
during the day (and 17¬∞C at night or in rooms that are not very busy).

Indeed, lowering the heating temperature by 1¬∞C represents an energy
saving of 7%.

logement . temp√©rature.question: What temperature do you heat your home to?
logement . temp√©rature.description:
This question simply allows us not to suggest lowering the temperature
when it is already relatively low.

logement . baisse temp√©rature . gains 1.description:
This is the estimated decrease in energy expenditure when we lower the
temperature of our heated home by 1¬∞C in the usual temperature range
(around 20¬∞).

We use the estimate given in the [ADEME
guide](https://www.ademe.fr/40-trucs-astuces-economiser-leau-lenergie)
"40 tricks to save water and energy".
logement . baisse temp√©rature . gains 1.note: Where is the source for this 7%? Can this figure be broken down for each type of energy (wood, gas, etc.)? How sensitive is this figure to the type of housing, its insulation, etc.?

logement . √©teindre appareils.description:
Our apartments and homes are full of digital devices and appliances,
which often remain on or on standby.

The use of simple power strips makes it possible to turn them off
completely in the blink of an eye.

The standby have made progress and individually consume less than in the
past: a European directive applicable since January 2017 limits their
power. It is 0.5 W for a number of categories of devices, but 3 W for
devices that remain connected to the Internet or data networks.

Source: ADEME - [Reducing your electricity
bill](https://www.ademe.fr/sites/default/files/assets/documents/guide-pratique-reduire-facture-electricite.pdf),
page 18.

logement . √©nergie de veille . puissanc.description: > The total power of these lights for a household often exceeds 50 Watt
logement . √©nergie de veille . puissanc.note:
It is quite possible that we underestimate the number of Watt in standby. In particular, it appears that the internet and TV boxes alone consume more than 50

> The "box" is an increasingly common piece of equipment, which often remains on 24 hours a day and generates a consumption that can exceed 200 kWh / year, or as much as the washing machine. Its total consumption over a year is between 150 and 300 kWh*: that is as much as a large refrigerator

logement . √©nergie de veille . temps d'.description:
It is assumed that on average, one is not present at home half of the
time, or one sleeps. At night (8 hours) and on average 4 hours during
the day, to take into account the weekends which compensate for the 8
hour working days, and the fact that not everyone in the household is
absent at the same time.

logement . remplacer fioul par bois.titre: Replace my oil-fired boiler with wood
logement . remplacer fioul par bois.description:
Oil-fired boilers are the most polluting. Replacing them with less
carbon-intensive alternatives such as wood pellets is a great way to
reduce your carbon footprint.
logement . remplacer fioul par bois.note: We consider for the moment that replacing the kWh of fuel oil by the same amount of kWh of wood is a good first order approximation. We will be able to adapt it later on according to the performance of the residential installations.

Replacing conventional light bulbs with low-energy bulbs such as LEDs can reduce your electricity consumption by a factor of 6

These bulbs consume very little electricity and have a very long life (up to 40,000 hours for the A++ categories).

logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.titre: Switch from gas boiler to heat pump
logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.description:
Gas-fired boilers are among the most CO‚ÇÇ emitting. Replacing them with
lower-carbon alternatives like heat pumps is a strong move to reduce
your carbon footprint.

> Heat pumps are often referred to as *PACs*.

üí° Their principle is ingenious: it's a reverse fridge! Your fridge,
thanks to a little electricity, cools its interior and rejects the heat
into the room. The heat pump cools the outside air to heat your home.

> Bonus: if it's too hot in your home in the summer, some heat pumps can
> reverse their operation and act as air conditioning in the summer.
logement . remplacer gaz par PAC.note: For the time being, we consider the replacement of gas kWh by the same amount of electricity kWh to be a good first-order approximation. We can then adapt it to the performance of residential installations. If you also heat your water with gas, you'll need to choose a heat pump that can also heat water. See ADEME PAC Guide

logement . r√©novation √©nerg√©tique BBC.note: Maximum energy gain achieved after a low-energy renovation, source to be specified.

logement . raccordement r√©seau de chale.note: A heating network is a system of pipes that allow heat produced locally and mainly from renewable and recovered energy sources to be conveyed to a group of buildings locally produced heat, mainly from renewable and recovered energy, to a group of buildings. It is an ecological and economical alternative to replace gas or oil boilers, it is an ecological and economical alternative to replace gas or oil boilers, both for collective housing buildings (condominiums, social housing) and for tertiary buildings. Nevertheless, being connected to a heating network is not as simple as subscribing to an electricity contract. Indeed, the feasibility of the connection depends on several technical conditions. First of all, the connection is made for a whole building: it is not possible to connect only your apartment. Secondly, it is necessary to check that there is a heating network near the building, and then to study the heating infrastructure within the building (a building equipped with a collective heating system will allow a connection at lower cost) Regarding the impact on the climate, it is important to know that in general, a heating network is supplied by local renewable or recovered energy sources (62% on average on a national scale), i.e., via household waste incineration, biomass combustion, geothermal energy... (as shown in the figure below) which considerably reduces the CO2 impact of the kWh of energy consumed in front of gas or fuel oil. However, the energy mix is very variable from one network to another, some networks are still mainly powered by fossil fuels (coal, oil, gas). It is therefore important to check the RE rate of the nearest network on the France Chaleur Urbaine map, and to ask the network manager on the future evolution of the energy mix, as many networks are in the process of becoming greener...]. ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/223733624-d50b2271-6da6-4ec7-a324-cec41df10430.png)
logement . raccordement r√©seau de chale.description: On average, 62% of the energy used to power these networks comes from local renewable and recovered energy sources (heat from waste incineration, biomass, geothermal energy, etc.), heating networks (or district heating) are a low-carbon and competitively priced heating method. However, there is a great disparity between networks, both in terms of carbon impact and rates! Connection to district heating is done on the scale of an entire building. It requires the presence of a heating network near the building and is easier when the building is already equipped with a collective heating system. >The France Chaleur Urbaine website allows you to go further: check if a heating network passes near your building!

services soci√©taux . voter.description:
Every year or so, we each have the opportunity to vote for representatives to represent our ideas.

Presidential, legislative, departmental and regional elections are the opportunity to bring the subject of the climate, and therefore the footprint of public services, and all the efforts that are complicated to do alone.

But that's not all! If you're a student, maybe there are votes to guide the work of the school or associations? If you are an employee, can you influence the trips offered by the works council? If you are retired, can you give your voice in the board of directors of your insurances, of the banks which have your money?

## For√ßage radiatif total

L'avion a un impact important sur le climat √† la fois √† cause de ses √©missions de CO‚ÇÇ et d'autres effets (dit for√ßage radiatif additionnel).

## Avion vs voiture

On entend souvent que ramen√©e au passager, elle est du m√™me ordre que celle d'une voiture. C'est vrai, mais ce n'est qu'une partie de l'histoire. 

Premi√®rement, l'empreinte de la voiture elle-m√™me est √©lev√©e. Comparer l'avion √† la voiture ne rend pas ce premier vertueux.

Quand il s'agit de choisir la destination des vacances par exemple, un trajet en voiture a donc toutes les chances d'√™tre beaucoup moins polluant. transport . arr√™ter l'avion court.description: The airplane has changed our way of life and our way of traveling. We can now go further, faster, more frequently, but unfortunately this is not without a downside for the climate Indeed, there is a ratio of 100 between the emission factors (quantity of CO‚ÇÇ emitted per km traveled) of a plane and a train > For example, a round trip from Paris to Marseille emits about 300 kgCO2eq by plane against only 2 kgCO2eq by train This is why we need to adapt our weekends and vacations by turning to low-carbon mobility offers and/or by rethinking our way of traveling is essential if we want to reduce our impact on the climate, both individually and as a society Compare modes of transportation here

transport . √©co-conduite.description:
Eco-driving is a simple and effective action that is within everyone's reach.

It can save an average of 15% in fuel consumption,
reduce vehicle maintenance costs, reduce the risk of accidents by an average of 10 to 15% and make substantial savings that can amount to several hundred
savings that can amount to several hundred euros

The application of eco-driving is all the more relevant in cities and urban areas where stops and restarts are frequent
restarting are frequent.

transport . covoiturage.description: This action concerns all his car trips. While long-distance carpooling is well known in France, short-distance carpooling is almost non-existent: today only 3% of home-work trips are made by carpooling. In any case, remember to adapt your mode of transportation to the distance and to favor soft modes or public transportation (bus, subway, bicycle, walking, etc.) as much as possible. The My Transport Impact calculator allows you to visualize and compare the impact of different modes of transport.
transport . covoiturage.note: See The Conversation article Under what conditions will car-sharing become a sustainable mode of transport?

transport . boulot . covoiturage.description:
While long-distance carpooling is well known in France, short-distance
carpooling is almost non-existent: today only 3% of home-to-work trips
are made by carpooling.

You should know that since 2020, you can ask your employer for the
[sustainable mobility
package](https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/actualites/A14046),
so that your carpooling is paid up to 400‚Ç¨/year, exempt from taxes and
social contributions!

In all cases, remember to adapt your mode of transport to the distance
and to favour soft modes or public transport (bus, metro, bike, walking,
etc.) as much as possible. The [My Transport
Impact](https://monimpacttransport.fr/) calculator allows you to
visualize and compare the impact of different modes of travel.
transport . boulot . covoiturage.note: See The Conversation article Under what conditions will car-sharing become a sustainable mode of transport?

transport . r√©duction covoiturage.description: One might naively think that carpooling divides the footprint per person by 2. But in reality, a study carried out in the √éle-de-France region shows that reductions are more in the order of 20%... before rebound effects, which reduce the final gain from carpooling to just 6%. ![](https://images.theconversation.com/files/297327/original/file-20191016-98644-c9y1zz.png?ixlib=rb-1.1.0&q=30&auto=format&w=754&h=588&fit=crop&dpr=2)

transport . boulot . distance . km aller.question: How far from home is your work?
transport . boulot . distance . km aller.description:
We are talking about the distance *going*, with the mode of transportation you prefer.

70% of the workers in France work less than 15km from their home.

57% work within 10km and 78% within 20km

Source: INSEE 2004 and 2013 studies, stable figures.
transport . boulot . distance . km aller.note: Link to the study and update with 2020 travel survey statistics if available.

transport . boulot . commun.titre: Go to work without a car
transport . boulot . commun.description:
When possible, taking public transport or light vehicles (walking,
cycling, personal moped, ...) to work reduces our climate footprint,
but also improves our quality of life.

[70%](https://www.ecologie-solidaire.gouv.fr/covoiturage-en-france-avantages-et-reglementationen-vigueur)
of home-work trips are made with individual vehicles, most of them alone
in their cars. This is what we call auto-solism.

In addition to emitting a lot of greenhouse gases, this auto-soloing is
detrimental to the quality of the air in our cities and therefore to our
health, and it clogs up urban roads.

> As an example traffic jams represent in Ile-de-France per year and per
> person [163 hours
> lost](https://www.tomtom.com/en_gb/traffic-index/paris-traffic) or
> about 6 days.

> üí° Did you know? The State and many regions or cities subsidize
> mechanical, electric, cargo, folding bikes, etc. [Calculate your aid
> üö≤Ô∏è in 3 clicks](https://mesaidesvelo.fr).

transport . voiture 5km.formule: transport . voiture . empreinte calcul√©e - transport . voiture 5km . recalcul
transport . voiture 5km.note: It is assumed that a person who does not own a car *already* does without a car for short trips.
transport . voiture 5km.description: In France, 4 out of 10 car journeys are less than 3 km long and no less than 177 million journeys of less than 5 km are made alone by car each week (excluding home-to-work journeys) All of these "short" trips taken together account for nearly 10% of the total distance traveled by car each year in France Thus, turning to active mobility (bicycle, moped, etc.) for these "short" trips can significantly reduce our GHG emissions emissions while relieving congestion on urban roads and improving air quality in our polluted cities. > Did you know? The state and many regions or cities subsidize mechanical, electric, cargo, folding bikes, etc. Calculate your subsidy üö≤Ô∏è in 3 clicks.

transport . super ethanol.titre: Switching from unleaded to super ethanol
transport . super ethanol.applicable si: transport . voiture . thermique . carburant = 'essence E5 et E10'
transport . super ethanol.formule: transport . voiture . empreinte calcul√©e - transport . super ethanol . recalcul avec surconsommation
transport . super ethanol.description:
Superethanol E85 is the unleaded gasoline fuel that can contain between 65% and 85% of bioethanol, the complement being unleaded gasoline 95
It is produced from sugar cane, cereals (wheat, corn) and sugar beet

E85 is a competitive fuel: even taking into account the extra consumption it generates, it allows a saving of 30 to 40 cents per liter of SP95 replaced.
To use it, it is possible to modify your gasoline vehicle by installing an approved conversion box, for about 1000‚Ç¨, amortized after 20 000 to 25 000 kilometers.
![](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/pictures/KlhzqieXAJSG5N_Reou0UdhPLKM/0x667:800x2147/fit-in/720x/filters:format(webp)/2018/10/12/php6RnMqG.png)
transport . super ethanol.note: This action is inactive.  In view of the issues related to land use change and other environmental impacts related to the cultivation of corn for example, biofuels** are not taken into account (the emission factor of the carbon base being particularly uncertain). See discussions [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1324)

transport . super ethanol . taux surcons.note: The E85 superethanol is less energetic, so it increases the number of liters consumed [by 15 to 25%](https://www.ledauphine.com/magazine-lifestyle/2020/02/02/ce-que-vous-devez-savoir-sur-le-superethanol-e85-avant-de-vous-lancer).

transport . scooter √©lectrique.formule: transport . deux roues - transport . scooter √©lectrique . recalcul
transport . scooter √©lectrique.description: The e-moped isn't a miracle solution, but for certain uses it can prove (very) useful in reducing our footprint. However, we must be careful not to reach the simplistic conclusion that switching to an electric vehicle fleet would be enough to decarbonize our travels. Whenever possible (55% of our journeys in France are less than 5km), the priority should be to promote active mobility (such as cycling) and public transport. Nevertheless, the figure we've given does correspond to the difference in greenhouse gas emissions that would have occurred if you had travelled your km with with an electric vehicle rather than a combustion engine. It's also important to bear in mind that the idea here is not to encourage you to buy a new electric moped, but rather to make your equipment last, and give preference to second-hand vehicles!

transport . voiture √©lectrique.formule: transport . voiture . empreinte calcul√©e - transport . voiture √©lectrique . recalcul
transport . voiture √©lectrique.description: The electric car is not a miracle solution but for certain uses it can be (very) useful to reduce our footprint. However, we must be careful not to come to the simplistic conclusion that all we need to do is switch to an electric car fleet to decarbonize French travel The priority must be, when possible (55% of our trips are less than 5km), the development of active mobility (such as cycling) and public transport. Nevertheless, the figure presented to you corresponds to the difference in greenhouse gas emissions that would have occurred if you had driven your kilometers with an electric vehicle and not a thermal one.
transport . voiture √©lectrique.note: Consider proposing this action only if it > 0 or > several hundred kgCO2eq

transport . voiture . limitation autorou.description: The Citizens' Climate Convention has proposed a reduction of the speed limit on highways from 130km/h to 110km/h in 2020 The proposal is detailed here Following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the International Energy Agency made this its 1st recommendation to reduce our purchases of Russian oil. Here we offer an assessment of this measure based on your specific situation.

![](https://imgur.com/NB9CUUt.jpg) From this graph, by graphical deduction (we have not yet gone back to the study data, page 151 figure 26), we find the data below. Diesel: 6.5 l/100 at 130km/h -> 4.75 at 110km/h Gasoline: 11.75 l/100 at 130km/h -> 8.65 at 110km/h So -27% in diesel and -26% in petrol by going from 130 to 110. We keep the order of magnitude of 25%.
transport . voiture . limitation autorou.note: This calculation should be refined. Some sources to investigate for the calculation. - a citizen who makes his test for a clio. He finds a reduction between -20% and -50% ! https://twitter.com/CptQwark_/status/1289499582871658499 Another citizen finds rather -10% with a bigger car - Report of the CGDD, where we have not found for the moment the explanation of the calculation of CO‚ÇÇ savings - Aur√©lien Bigo who criticizes the CGDD report https://twitter.com/AurelienBigo/status/1276459283291439114, but who does not give us any information about the calculation of the CO‚ÇÇ itself. - another evaluation, which gives us the calculation :) : https://twitter.com/Tomsawy22670318/status/1274257122373570565 Attention, to be rigorous, as mentioned in this last thread, it is necessary to take into account the distribution of the speed and the category of car (presence of a 6th gear for example). Obviously, we do not drive at 130 all the time.

transport . km autoroute.question: How many kilometers per year do you drive on the highway (approximately)?
transport . km autoroute.description: We travel about 80 billion km / year on the highway (car).
transport . km autoroute.note: Interesting twitter feed on the subject: https://twitter.com/Tomsawy22670318/status/1274257124701462528.

alimentation.description:
What we eat, and to a lesser extent what we drink, largely influences
our climate footprint.

The first factor is the quantity of meat and dairy products: - the
production of a kilo of meat emits CO‚ÇÇ, but also other gases (such as
methane) which warm up the climate much more quickly - we have to feed
the animals with cereal products that we could have eaten ourselves,
often resulting from deforestation.

Contrary to what we often hear, the distance our food travels, the
seasonality of fruits and vegetables, and the amount of plastic
packaging are in the background.

alimentation . boisson . chaude.question: What is your hot beverage consumption in a typical week (number of cups per week)?
alimentation . boisson . chaude.description:
Your hot beverage consumption in a typical week. One coffee a day? Tea every evening? Hot chocolate for breakfast?

Note that you can select the type of milk you drink in another question!

> The coffee or tea you drink for breakfast is also taken into account here!

alimentation . boisson . chaude . th√© ..note: The average French person consumes 250g of tea a year ( source), or 5 grams a week. We have estimated that this corresponds to approximately 3 cups a week.

alimentation . boisson . chaude . chicor.question: Number of cups of chicory per week

it is assumed that a cup of coffee contains an average of 12 grams of ground coffee.

alimentation . boisson . tasse de th√© ..note:
For the footprint of a cup of coffee or hot chocolate, the portion
related to consumption (heating of water in particular) is not taken
into account in the emission factor, which is not the case for the
emission factor of tea from Agribalyse. If the drink is drunk at home,
the consumption is already included in the electricity bill of the home.
However, if it is taken in a caf√©, the consumption footprint must be
added. We have chosen not to include the consumption of hot drinks (the
share linked to consumption being negligible for coffee and hot
chocolate before coffee beans or cocoa)
Emission factor from Agibalyse, unsweetened brewed tea.
According to the breakdown from Agibalyse, unsweetened brewed tea, consumption accounts for 25% of the tea emission factor.
A cup of tea is assumed to weigh an average of 250 grams.

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.question: Do you drink bottled water?
alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description:
If you mainly drink tap water, and your consumption of bottled water is limited to rare occasions (for example, one bakery meal a week, with their famous "sandwich + dessert + bottled plastic drink" menu), answer no. We'll be happy to help you.

If you regularly buy packs of bottled water at the supermarket, or buy a small bottle every day at the canteen at work, answer yes.

> You should know that drinking tap water has such a small climate footprint that we won't ask you about your water consumption.
alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.note: On average, the French drink between 100 and 150 liters of bottled water a year , or around a third of our daily requirement of 1-1.5 liters . We therefore considered the default value to be "no".
Emission factor derived from Agibalyse, bottled spring water.
The average consumption of bottled water in 2018 is 135 liters per year per inhabitant (or 90 bottles), according to the syndicat des eaux min√©rales naturelles source)

alimentation . boisson . eau en bouteill.description: It is assumed that each person drinks 1.5 liters of water per day.

alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es.description:
Note that alternatives to soda, very simple to prepare at home, are
possible: this is the case of
[kefir](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C3%A9fir) or
[Kombucha](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kombucha). We have not yet
evaluated the footprint gains offered by these alternatives.
alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es.formule: litres * commun . semaines par an * facteur

alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es . fact.note: This value is of course very approximate.
Emission factor from Agribalysis, Cola, sweet, 0.51 kgCO2e/kg. Density assumed to be 1kg/l.
Emission factor from Agribalysis, Multifruit juice, pure juice, standard, 0.91 kgCO2e/kg. Density is assumed to be 1kg/l.

alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es . litr.question: What is your weekly consumption of soft drinks, fruit juices, etc.?
alimentation . boisson . sucr√©es . litr.note: Consumption of soft drinks and sugar-sweetened beverages in France averages 50.9 liters per capita ( source), or around 1 liter per week.

alimentation . boisson . alcool.description:
Surprisingly, our alcohol consumption plays a significant role in our
footprint.

The good news is that we can improve it in very simple ways: more than
food, a drink is heavy, travels a lot, and its packaging has a
significant footprint.

> Let's take the example of a üç∫ 25cl beer: brewed at the end of the
> world, it has traveled thousands of miles and its contents (the drink)
> are packaged in a container that weighs almost the same (200g of
> glass).

> By favoring a locally brewed beer, served on draft (the keg being
> reused for years), we can drastically reduce the footprint without
> changing the consumption.
alimentation . boisson . alcool.formule: litres * commun . semaines par an * facteur

alimentation . boisson . alcool . facteu.note: Wine doesn't have the same footprint as beer by the liter, that's a big simplification.
Emission factor from Agribalyse, core market beer), 1.12 kgCO2e/kg. Beer density is assumed to be 1kg/l.
Emission factor from Agribalysis, dry white wine, 1.22 kgCO2e/kg. Wine density is assumed to be 1kg/l.
Emission factor from Agribalyse, rum-based cocktail, 0.91 kgCO2e/kg. The density of a cocktail is assumed to be 1kg/l.

alimentation . boisson . alcool . litres.question: What is your weekly consumption of alcohol (wine, beer, etc.)?
alimentation . boisson . alcool . litres.note: Alcohol consumption in France is 79.6 liters, all alcohols combined, or about 1.5 liters per week ( source)

alimentation . d√©chets . quantit√© jet√.description: > Answer 'Zero Waste' only if you track every single waste. To learn more about zero waste lifestyles, visit Zero Waste France. > Be aware that in case of a "zero waste" commitment, we still consider emissions (but largely reduced) because it is very difficult or even impossible to generate no waste, some being it is very difficult, if not impossible, to generate no waste, some of which is invisible and unavoidable.

alimentation . d√©chets . quantit√© jet√.titre: I throw away without paying attention
alimentation . d√©chets . quantit√© jet√.description: You tend to throw away without question.

You still have some progress to make to reach the zero waste level.
However, you are implementing eco-gestures to reduce your impact?
Select this answer and go to the next question!

A particularly strong level of commitment! The size of your trash can is
minimal, you *hardly* ever throw away!

alimentation . d√©chets . notif z√©ro d√.description:
You have entered a zero waste lifestyle. It is important to know that
this level of commitment corresponds to a person who is **100%**
committed to **reducing waste**. Consuming in bulk is not enough to be
zero waste.

somme: omr . putrescibles . non compostable + omr . putrescibles . compost√©s

alimentation . d√©chets . niveau z√©ro d.note: Even within the zero-waste movement, the proportion of people who actually live a zero-waste lifestyle is not very representative. Therefore, we consider that a zero-waste lifestyle corresponds to a division by 4 of all other waste quantities (household waste, household solid waste and landfill). Only putrescible waste is excluded from these reductions, as it does not involve packaging. See ADEME's Bien vivre en z√©ro d√©chet analysis.

alimentation . d√©chets . niveau moyen.description: This level corresponds to the French average.

The different actions you can already take to reduce your trash

If you make little or no effort to avoid throwing away your food, answer

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . stop.question: Do you have a "stop ads" sign on your mailbox?
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . stop.description:
It is a sticker to be placed on your mailbox that informs the
advertising distributors that you refuse to receive catalogs,
promotions, restaurant menus and advertisements of any kind.

This does not prevent all advertising, but it sends a strong signal and
generally reduces considerably the amount of paper waste received.

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . stop.titre: I have a "no ads" sticker on my mailbox

alimentation . d√©chets . bonus stop pub.note: We consider 3 flyers per week in his mailbox

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . achet.question: Do you buy in bulk?
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . achet.note: For now, this getse remains inactive. The impact being relatively small compared to the total amount of waste, it will be a matter of deepening the figure from the ADEME study on avoidance deposits gave a potential reduction of 2.4kg/inhabitant/year by consuming in bulk. Another ADEME study more recent and more complete is to be investigated to specify this impact. We could also act directly on the quantity of packaging, cardboard and plastic, of the waste sub-items. (e.g. food . waste . gestures . omr . plastics . quantity)

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . bonus.note: A more recent and comprehensive study to be investigated to clarify this action: https://librairie.ademe.fr/consommer-autrement/5064-panorama-et-evaluation-environnementale-du-vrac-en-france.html.

Source: Page 47 of [the ADEME study](https://librairie.ademe.fr/dechets-economie-circulaire/2520-etude-d-evaluation-des-gisements-d-evitement-des-potentiels-de-reduction-de-dechets-et-des-impacts-environnementaux-evites.html)
According to the table, 22% of packaging avoided is paper/cardboard, 78% is plastic.

alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . bonus.titre: Average reduction per capita of the "buy in bulk" action
alimentation . d√©chets . gestes . bonus.note: Source: Page 47 of the ADEME study Based on the 11 product categories detailed above, the packaging avoidance target of the bulk sales alternative can be estimated at 2.4 kg/inhabitant/year in 2012 at the national level. These results only concern a limited number of products, but they are those that are often offered for sale in bulk. These data take into account the removal of product packaging by the bulk device, but do not take into account the containers offered to customers for this purchase, so the actual avoidance of the action is less.
Emission factor from Base Carbone (Plastic - average - new)
Emission factor from Base Carbone (Cardboard - new)

alimentation . plats.question: Choose your lunch and dinner dishes for a typical week
alimentation . plats.description:
Choose 14 dishes that represent your typical week: 7 lunches and 7
dinners.

> Today we are working to ensure that the menus associated with your
> meals are as representative as possible of your habits. Feel free to
> go further by browsing [the
> documentation](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation/alimentation/plats).
alimentation . plats.note: For the time being, we propose 6 typical meals for 6 different diets. It has been decided to limit the granularity of the model to 6 menus representative of the associated diets, to simplify the estimation of the footprint of the food item for the user (the specificities of each diet could give rise to a complete simulator dedicated to food). They are based on the representative diets documented by ADEME, updated with the emission factors available via Agribalyse. The average meal breakdown is based on a multi-factor consolidation (total quantity of food consumed, quantity of meat and fish consumed, energy intake, average carbon footprint of a meal) based on data from the INCA 3 study and the work carried out for meals in the carbon base. to approximate the average French diet. üßÆ The detailed calculation is available here in spreadsheet form. Some important assumptions: - Meat" and "fish" meals are only declined with a "normal" amount of meat and fish. - For each meal, fruit and vegetables are considered "out of season" to allow for the "in season" bonus - For each meal, ingredients are considered "non-local" to allow for the "local" bonus - All foods are considered to be raw in the proposed menus. 2 associated challenges - Avoid double-counting linked to the "consumption" part of the FE Agribalsye, already included in your electricity or gas bill. - Think in terms of "real quantity" before cooking, which dries out the food and therefore reduces its weight.

alimentation . plats . v√©g√©talien . em.note: For the moment, in the absence of a typical vegan meal in the carbon base, we take the footprint of the vegetarian meal, in which we substitute the 2 eggs with tofu and nuts in the starter, which then becomes a salad, keeping approximately the same quantities of calories and proteins. > Note: one wonders why the recipe mentions an onion omelette without including the onions. Negligible? We've added them. Finally, it's worth noting that the tofu considered here could be replaced by French soya and decarbonized French tofu production, notably to avoid deforestation and further reduce emissions, giving rise to a local vegan diet. See this paper on soy and deforestation. üßÆ The detailed calculation is available here as a spreadsheet.

alimentation . plats . v√©g√©talien . no.question: Number of vegan dishes per week

alimentation . plats . v√©g√©tarien . em.note:
This is "Vegetarian Meal 1"
[here](https://www.bilans-ges.ademe.fr/documentation/UPLOAD_DOC_FR/index.htm?repas.htm),
[updated with Agribalyse emission
factors](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SVYvBaaYDOUDcg5jX0eZFEColnWWIL8PCLMGrPR000o/edit#gid=1694091424).

> Note: one wonders why the recipe mentions an onion omelet without
> including the onions. Negligible? We added them.

üßÆ The detailed calculation is [available
here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SVYvBaaYDOUDcg5jX0eZFEColnWWIL8PCLMGrPR000o/edit#gid=1694091424)
in spreadsheet form.

alimentation . plats . v√©g√©tarien . no.question: Number of vegetarian dishes per week

alimentation . plats . viande 1 . emprei.titre: Footprint of a meat type meal 1 (chicken, pork, cheese)
alimentation . plats . viande 1 . emprei.note: This is "Classic Meal 1 (with chicken)", updated with Agribalyse emission factors. The emission factor associated with the main ingredient (here the piece of poultry or pork) corresponds to an average of the Agribalyse emission factors associated with pork (piece of meat and charcuterie), chicken, turkey and duck. This average is weighted according to actual French consumption by type of animal meat. üßÆ The detailed calculation is available here in spreadsheet form.

alimentation . plats . viande 1 . nombre.question: Number of meat dishes 1 per week

alimentation . plats . viande 2 . emprei.titre: Footprint of a meat type 2 meal (beef, veal, lamb)
alimentation . plats . viande 2 . emprei.note: This is the "Classic Meal 2 (with beef)" here, updated with Agribalyse emission factors. The emission factor associated with the main ingredient (here the piece of red meat) corresponds to an average of Agribalyse emission factors associated with beef, lamb and veal. This average is weighted according to actual French consumption by type of animal meat. üßÆ The detailed calculation is available here in spreadsheet format.

alimentation . plats . viande 2 . nombre.question: Number of meat dishes 2 per week

alimentation . plats . poisson 1 . empre.titre: Footprint of a fish type meal 1 (tuna, salmon, sardine, mackerel)
alimentation . plats . poisson 1 . empre.note: For the time being, in the absence of fish meals in the carbon base, we propose a fish menu based on the "classic meals" in the carbon base. The main course is a salmon tart. The emission factor associated with the main ingredient (here salmon) corresponds to an average of emission factors associated with tuna, salmon, sardines or mackerel from Agribalyse. This average is weighted according to actual French consumption by type of fish and packaging. üßÆ The detailed calculation is available here in spreadsheet format.

alimentation . plats . poisson 1 . nombr.question: Number of fish dishes 1 per week

alimentation . plats . poisson 2 . empre.titre: Footprint of a white fish meal
alimentation . plats . poisson 2 . empre.note: For the time being, in the absence of fish meals in the carbon base, we propose a fish menu based on the "classic meals" in the carbon base. The main course is a white fish fillet with white butter sauce. The emission factor associated with the main ingredient (in this case, white fish) corresponds to an average of emission factors associated with various white fish (sea bass, cod, monkfish, hake...) from Agribalyse. This average is weighted according to actual French consumption by type of fish. üßÆ The detailed calculation is available here in spreadsheet form.

alimentation . plats . poisson 2 . nombr.question: Number of fish dishes 2 per week

alimentation . plan√©taire.description: A plan described in 2019 to reconcile health and the environment. Lots of vegetables and fruit, whole grains, proteins and vegetable oils, a little milk and cheese, a little meat and fish, and a little added sugar. In contrast to the vague "flexitarian" diet, the planetary diet is described very precisely. ![](https://eatforum.org/content/uploads/2019/02/EAT-Lancet_PHD_Plate_RGB-02.png)

There's an infinite variety of breakfasts. We've selected a few to give you an easy answer.

Even if you can't find your exact breakfast, choose the one that comes closest!

> Please note that your consumption of fruit juice / coffee / tea / hot chocolate is counted in the question dedicated to hot drinks.

alimentation . petit d√©jeuner . type ..description:
We have chosen to consider a standard French breakfast close to the
["continental"](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/D√©jeuner#Repas_de_type_continental)
breakfast. It includes bread, butter, jam, pastries and a fruit.

A bowl of milk or yogurt with cereal. The origin (animal or vegetable)
of the milk you drink will be asked later!
A savory breakfast: toast, eggs, cold cuts. We've lightened the traditional English or Irish breakfast, which also includes baked beans, sausages, tomatoes, mushrooms and potatoes.

You don't eat anything for breakfast (but you can drink coffee, tea or
hot chocolate which is counted in another question).

alimentation . local . consommation.question: Do you consume local products?
alimentation . local . consommation.description:
This question allows us to adjust the footprint of your diet according to your habits about the local nature of your purchases.

We consider "local" to be food that comes from the region where you live or from nearby regions.

This criterion has a relatively low impact, because the share of transport in the carbon footprint of the products we consume is lower than the emissions linked to production, processing or packaging, especially when your diet is meat-based.

But it's still a win-win situation, and the benefits of eating locally don't stop at the climate footprint.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Be careful, if you do your shopping by car several kilometres from home each week, it's possible that the last kilometre's footprint will exceed the gains from eating locally!
alimentation . local . consommation.note: See details of the calculation approach [here](http://nosgestesclimat/documentation/alimentation/local/part-locale)

alimentation . local . niveau.description: A coefficient of 0.333 and 0.666 is applied if the user indicates that he/she consumes local "sometimes" or "often" respectively.

alimentation . local . part locale annue.formule: part locale * commun . semaines par an

alimentation . local . part locale.description:
In a first approach, we chose to work on the menus proposed in the
simulator by considering the emission factors of Agribalyse, updated by
dividing the share of transport by 2.
alimentation . local . part locale.note: These coefficients are obtained by reconstituting typical meals from the Base Carbone with equivalent products from Agribalyse and taking into account a transport share divided by 2. More concretely, the ratio = reconstituted meal with transport divided by 2 / reconstituted meal. üßÆ The detailed calculation is available here in spreadsheet format.

variations.sinon: facteur de saison * part de saison

alimentation . de saison . consommation.question: Do you eat seasonal products?
alimentation . de saison . consommation.description: This question enables us to correct the imprint of your diet on the seasonal nature of your purchases. This impact is relatively low, as the proportion of seasonal products represents only 7% of the average French person's diet. But that's still something, and the benefits of seasonal consumption don't stop at the climate footprint. > But when is an apple or cauliflower in season? > Discover our mini-site Mes fruits et l√©gumes de saison.
alimentation . de saison . consommation.note: See details of the calculation approach [here](http://nosgestesclimat/documentation/alimentation/de-saison/pourcentage-saisonable)

alimentation . de saison . niveau.description: A coefficient of 0.333 and 0.666 is applied if the user indicates that he or she consumes seasonal produce "sometimes" or "often" respectively.

alimentation . de saison . ratio.description:
This coefficient of 2.26 is derived from Agribalyse by averaging the
ratios of the same product considered "in season" and "out of season".

This coefficient is subject to a high degree of uncertainty since the
in-season/out-of-season data only concerns 2 products in Agribalyse
(tomatoes and strawberries).
alimentation . de saison . ratio.note:
This calculation method is imperfect: ideally, we could make the
difference between in-season and out-of-season on each dish of the
user's personalized diet. But Agribalyse does not yet give the
seasonal/unseasonal cut for each food.

However, it does have the merit of giving a first order of magnitude.

üßÆ The spreadsheet for the detailed calculation is [available
here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/data/alimentation/alimentation%20.%20de%20saison%20.%20ratio.ods).

alimentation . de saison . part de saiso.formule: pourcentage de saison * (petit d√©jeuner annuel + d√©jeuner et d√Æner)
alimentation . de saison . part de saiso.description:
The percentage of seasonal products is applied to an individual's total
meals.

alimentation . de saison . pourcentage d.titre: Percentage of season of the average meal footprint
alimentation . de saison . pourcentage d.description: In a first approach, we have chosen to estimate the share of the footprint of seasonal products in the footprint of the average French meal calculated from the INCA 3 survey (2017). These products include fruits and vegetables that can be purchased "directly" in season, as well as other processed products, such as fruit juices, soups and compotes, which can be purchased with knowledge of the product's production date. We have chosen to exclude potatoes from the calculation, as they can be harvested almost all year round, thanks to their many varieties.
alimentation . de saison . pourcentage d.note:
This method of calculation is imperfect: ideally, we could make the
difference between seasonal and non-seasonal on each dish of the user's
personalized diet. However, in a future version of the calculation we
will be able to differentiate the percentage for each element of the
diet.

However, it has the merit of giving a first order of magnitude.

üßÆ The spreadsheet of the detailed calculation is [available
here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/data/alimentation/alimentation%20.%20de%20saison%20.%20pourcentage%20saisonable.ods).

bilan.description: Here is an estimate of your climate footprint for the year. It evolves according to your answers. It is your share of greenhouse gas emissions, and therefore of global warming. All the footprints of companies are included. For example, if you drive a car üöó 10 km, the emissions are not attributed to the country that extracted this oil from the ground, nor to the company that refined it and distributed it in gas stations, but to the final consumer in his car. If we add up this footprint for each French person and each other üåç earthling, we get the total impact of human activities on the climate. *Please note: this simulator gives the order of magnitude of your footprint and that of the French: the estimate is not to be taken to the nearest tenth.* But what does it mean, this ten tons of CO‚ÇÇ equivalent? Why is it important? **We tell you all about the climate footprint** and how to locate this footprint (low, high?) ‚û° in this article.

divers . ameublement.note: We only count the footprint of furniture manufacturing and distribution. So be careful not to confuse ADEME's LCA data data (which take into account the entire life cycle: from cradle to grave) and the Base Carbone's EFs, which only give the impact of a product's manufacture the impact of a product's manufacture (although the "distribution" phase is included in the EF). These EFs do not take into account the "end-of-life" phase, which is taken into account via the NGC waste model (which takes into account the quantities of waste taken to waste collection centers, where furniture is (theoretically) taken at the end of its life). We consider that all the furniture is used by the whole household, even if some of it may only be used individually, which is a limitation of the test.

divers . ameublement . meubles.question: What furniture do you own that is less than 10 years old?
divers . ameublement . meubles.description:
Enter here the furnishings that make up the interior of your home, less than 10 years old; and only products purchased new, 
we exclude second-hand and warehouse sales.

Don't forget your kitchen furniture!  

We consider that all furniture is used by the whole household, even if some of it may only be used individually (beds, for example), which is a limitation of the test.

Don't hesitate to use the categories small furniture (weighing less than 10 kg, such as a small sideboard or coffee table) or large furniture (weighing more than 10 kg) 
or large furniture (over 10 kg, such as a large desk) if you can't categorize what you've got in the rest of the suggestions.
divers . ameublement . meubles.note:
The data are all taken from the Base Carbone (goods purchases). See https://bilans-ges.ademe.fr/fr/accueil/documentation-gene/index/page/Mobilier.

Default values have been defined arbitrarily, including kitchen furniture, notably in the small/large furniture ratios composed of:

- 3 small pieces of furniture: 2 shelves, a coffee table.
- 5 large units: 2 kitchen wall units, 3 base units.

divers . ameublement . pr√©servation.question: What effort do you make to keep your furniture as long as possible?
divers . ameublement . pr√©servation.description:
To avoid asking you to provide the exact age of all the furnishings you own, we have defined an average age for each item (generally 10 years).

> We are not trying to evaluate the age of the furniture before it becomes unusable, but the age when the owners decide to replace it with new furniture.
It is up to you to place yourself in relation to the average.

divers . ameublement . coefficient pr√©s.note:
We define a grid of consumer behaviors, from frequent new buyers to those who make a major effort to keep their furniture as long as possible.
We consider that the person who declares that he or she often buys new keeps his or her furniture for half of its average lifespan, while the person who keeps his or her furniture postpones its average lifespan.
This grid may evolve if new sources or studies are added.

divers . animaux domestiques.description: We speak here about domestic animals, whose population increase (about 10 millions of cats in France in 2000 against 15 million currently (2020)) is linked to human beings (unlike wild animals, whose History seems to show a stable GES balance). According to the FACCO annual report (Chambre Syndicale des Fabricants d'Aliments pour Chiens, Chats, Oiseaux et autres animaux familiiers) 2022 43.5% of French households own at least one cat or dog. Nearly 1 out of 3 French households owns a cat and 1 out of 5 owns a dog. It is therefore clear that we cannot ignore the footprint of our pets and these emissions are, by definition, of anthropogenic origin. The domestic life of our animals leads to additional emissions to be attributed to a human individual (the one who owns the animal). According to the study Environmental Impacts of a Pet Dog: An LCA Case Study, 2020, it appears that 90% of a pet's climate footprint comes from its diet (relative to the impact of animal waste and associated waste according to the scope of the study). For our case, we initially considered feed and veterinary services, which represent only a few kilos of CO‚ÇÇ whereas feed is responsible for hundreds of kilos for some animals. > We consider that an animal belongs to a household. In the same way as an object shared within the household, the footprint of an animal is amortized as well.
divers . animaux domestiques.note: For the impact of food, we used the paper: The global environmental paw print of pet food, 2020, which presents an interesting methodology. On this subject, the article "Environmental Impacts of a Pet Dog: An LCA Case Study" cites The European Pet Food Industry Federation (FEDIAF); C&D Foods; FACCO, Chambre Syndicale des Fabricants d'Aliments pour Chiens, Chats, Oiseaux et autres Animaux Familiers (the French Pet Food Association for Dogs, Cats, Birds and Other Domestic Pets); Mars PetCare Europe; Nestl√© Purina PetCare Europe; saturn petcare gmbh, and Quantis. Product Environmental Footprint Screening Study-Prepared Pet Food or Cats and Dogs; The European Pet Food Industry Federation: Brussels, Belgium, 2015, unfortunately no longer available... Some questions could be explored further: - Is it relevant to associate a "basic" footprint per animal linked to the purchase of equipment or the like? - The emission factor selected for our calculation is the result of a study with a specific methodological approach (i.e. a choice of assumptions specific to the work carried out for this article). It will be necessary to continue monitoring developments in order to gain a more in-depth understanding of the life cycle of this type of food (including packaging?).

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.question: How many pets live with you in your home?
divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.description:
Dog or cat, it's time to take into account our faithful companions.

> ü¶¥ The impact of your pet is largely related to its bowl!

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.question: How many cats do you have in your household?

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.titre: Fingerprint of a medium sized cat
divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.description: We consider a cat of average size (4kg).

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.formule: besoin journalier nourriture * commun . jours par an * empreinte nourriture

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.note: For this emission factor, we used the paper: The global environmental paw print of pet food, 2020 A few comments on the methodology used in this article: Animal by-products (ABPs) are products of animal origin not consumed by humans, and are the main ingredients of food for... animals. ![](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/317818426/figure/fig1/AS:614100279230464@1523424324126/General-descriptions-of-edible-and-inedible-by-products.png) We might imagine that transforming these "leftovers" to feed our animals is the best option, but we mustn't forget that there are alternatives: fertilizer, biofuel. While 1kg of animal "by-products" certainly doesn't have the same environmental impact as a kilogram of steak, we can't consider the impact to be zero. Nevertheless, as you might imagine, there are no EFs associated with these by-products. The idea of this article is to to approximate the footprint of these products by prorating them by product price. The final result is 2.3 times higher using a conventional method based on : 1kg animal by-products = 1kg steak = 1 EF in kgco2e/kg. As far as feed "quality" is concerned, two types of feed are considered: Two types of food are considered: - Classic" cat food (croquette type): 1.5 kgCO2e/kg, making up 2/3 of the average cat food. - Premium" cat food (closer to pate, it seems): 4.5 kgCO2e/kg, making up 1/3 of the average cat food. This gives an average value of 2 kgCO2e/kg of cat food. A priori, only the production part is accounted for. We'd need to go into more detail in the calculation sources to find out whether distribution or packaging is taken into account. Finally, with regard to geographical scope, this study is based on data for the United States, which would seem, given the similarity of markets with Europe, to be legitimately applicable to France. Furthermore, the study Environmental impact of diets for dogs and cats, 20222 gives much higher results, particularly for "wet food". > If a 10 kg dog with an average caloric intake of 534 kcal per day15 is considered, we can estimate the yearly consumption of calories and, therefore, can estimate the annual environmental impact. If we consider the results of the present study, the median of CO2eq of a dry diet per 1000 kcal is 4.25 kg and a wet diet of 33.56 kg. This average dog would be responsible for 828.37 kg of CO2eq per year if consuming dry diets or 6,541 kg of CO2eq per year if consuming wet diets. In view of the particularly high figures, and pending further investigation of this study, we have preferred to use the figures from the study mentioned above, which appears to adopt a consistent methodology.

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.description: Figures and tables from FEDIAF, Nutritional Guidelines For a cat, we use the formula: (cat weight)^0.67 * 100 kcal for an average active animal. Here, we consider a cat of 4kg, moderately active, which gives the figures visible in the tables below. ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/229522212-30dde3ac-0c96-42f4-925a-78f122185b64.png) ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/228851632-28ad3746-7fd2-4b80-8923-a76f75dc8012.png)

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.note: Formula: (cat weight)^0.67, formula from FEDIAF, Nutritional Guidelines Publicodes does not support the power function. We consider a cat of 4kg.
We use the formula: (cat weight)^0.67 * 100 kcal for a medium active animal, (cat weight)^0.67 * 75 kcal for a less active cat (indoor cat).

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.note: The impact of litter seems to reside mainly in waste. This impact should be investigated in detail in the "waste" part of the test.

How many dogs do you have in your household?

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.formule: besoin journalier nourriture * commun . jours par an * empreinte nourriture

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.note: For this emission factor, we used the paper: The global environmental paw print of pet food, 2020 A few comments on the methodology used in this article: Animal by-products (ABPs) are products of animal origin not consumed by humans, and are the main ingredients of food for... animals. ![](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/317818426/figure/fig1/AS:614100279230464@1523424324126/General-descriptions-of-edible-and-inedible-by-products.png) We might imagine that transforming these "leftovers" to feed our animals is the best option, but we mustn't forget that there are alternatives: fertilizer, biofuel. While 1kg of animal "by-products" certainly doesn't have the same environmental impact as a kilogram of steak, we can't consider the impact to be zero. Nevertheless, as you might imagine, there are no EFs associated with these by-products. The idea of this article is to to approximate the footprint of these products by prorating them by product price. The final result is 2.3 times higher using a conventional method based on : 1kg animal by-products = 1kg steak = 1 EF in kgco2e/kg. As far as feed "quality" is concerned, two types of feed are considered: - Classic" dog food (croquette type): 3 kgCO2e/kg, making up 2/3 of the average dog food. - Premium" dog food (closer to pat√©, it seems): 7 kgCO2e/kg, making up 1/3 of the average dog's diet. This gives an average value of 4.3 kgCO2e/kg of dog food. A priori, only the production part is accounted for. We'd have to go into more detail to find out whether distribution or packaging is taken into account. Finally, with regard to geographical scope, this study is based on data for the United States, which would seem, given the similarity of markets with Europe, to be legitimately applicable to France. Furthermore, the study Environmental impact of diets for dogs and cats, 20222 gives much higher results, particularly for "wet food". > If a 10 kg dog with an average caloric intake of 534 kcal per day15 is considered, we can estimate the yearly consumption of calories and, therefore, can estimate the annual environmental impact. If we consider the results of the present study, the median of CO2eq of a dry diet per 1000 kcal is 4.25 kg and a wet diet of 33.56 kg. This average dog would be responsible for 828.37 kg of CO2eq per year if consuming dry diets or 6,541 kg of CO2eq per year if consuming wet diets. In view of the particularly high figures, and pending further investigation of this study, we have preferred to use the figures from the study mentioned above, which appears to adopt a consistent methodology.

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.description: Figures and tables from FEDIAF, Nutritional Guidelines We use the formula: (dog weight)^0.75 * 110 kcal for a moderately active animal.

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.note: Formula: (dog weight)^0.75, formula from FEDIAF, Nutritional Guidelines Publicodes does not support the power function. We consider dogs of 5, 20 and 40kg.

We use the formula: (dog weight)^0.75 * 125 kcal for a very active dog, (dog weight)^0.67 * 110 for an active dog, (dog weight)^0.67 * 95 kcal for a less active dog.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/229539516-3f548d73-1129-48f3-900a-f9fd30317d4c.png)
> An average gross energy of cat and dog food of 461 kcal/100 g (Davies et al., 2017). From The global environmental paw print of pet food, 2020

divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.titre: Fingerprints associated with the animal's veterinary care
divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.description: This figure, associated with the footprint corresponding to the animal's veterinary care, is derived by dividing the macro-economic footprint associated with veterinary care by the number of pets (excluding fish).
divers . animaux domestiques . empreinte.note: The idea is to start from the macro-economic footprint associated with the NAF M75 branch (Veterinary activities). INSEE gives this description: - Medical, surgical and dental services provided to pets in veterinary clinics or elsewhere. The purpose of these services is to care for the animals, improve and/or stabilize their state of health. - Hospital services, laboratory services, technical services, food (including special diets), etc. According to the FACCO annual report, in 2020 France will have 75 million pets. Assuming that fish do not benefit from veterinary care, we reach 49 million animals. We have also deducted backyard birds, which apparently do not require clinical care, bringing us to **35.7 million animals**. ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/229517254-01e77c3d-acef-4053-9b8f-2931a6ce33a9.png) We can then deduce the average footprint of veterinary services per animal.
