logement . piscine . surface.question: What is the size of your swimming pool ?
logement . piscine . surface.note:
By default, 8x4m, i.e. 32m¬≤
> From the classic 8x4m rectangle to more modest 7x3.5m pools, or the more imposing 9x4.5m and more, there are many possible variations. An 8 m x 4 m pool seems sufficient for family use, while limiting maintenance and the volume of water to be treated. It's a good compromise between price and surface area.
logement . piscine . surface.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. üí° Don't forget to include **the pool's energy consumption in those of your home**. If your pool is heated, your bill should be greatly affected!

logement . piscine.description: The number of private pools **buried** in French gardens has accelerated in recent years. There are now over 3 million of them. This equipment is far from anecdotal, and contributes significantly to France's climate footprint. It's the construction, maintenance, purchase of various equipment (safety, water management, sanitary chemicals) and heating that have the biggest impact on the climate.

logement . piscine . pr√©sent.question: Do you have a private in-ground swimming pool ?
logement . piscine . pr√©sent.description: We're talking here about private **in-ground** pools, not above-ground pools, which have a much smaller carbon footprint. However, this option will be available soon!
logement . piscine . pr√©sent.note:
Today, we're asking this question of everyone who owns a house.
In order to limit the appearance of this question for users who don't own land, or who are absolutely not concerned by swimming pools, 
we could filter the question according to the surface area of the house, for example.

logement . piscine . empreinte.description: This model for calculating the carbon footprint of a swimming pool comes from Futur.eco, taken from the publicodes model with its default values. It's the only open model of an individual pool's carbon footprint published to date. In this first version, we do not specifically take into account the use of the filter pump or heating, whose footprint is implicitly calculated as part of the home's energy consumption. At a later stage, it might be useful to separate the 2 consumptions so as to propose more personalized actions. Note that the water consumption aspect is not covered here as a matter of principle (our calculations focus on carbon emissions), but it is obviously essential to pay attention to it.
logement . piscine . empreinte.note:
To better understand the calculation of the pool's footprint, here are a few points:
  
  - The water footprint depends on both supply and treatment      
  - Water evaporation is not taken into account
  - It is assumed that the pool is refilled every year: this is a strong assumption, but acceptable in the sense that people who keep their pool water in winter will consume more chemicals.
  - Construction takes many factors into account: masonry, waterproofing, technical equipment, etc., for "concrete" pools
  - Chemical treatment is a constant today. It could be made variable according to the size or number of months the pool is used.
  - Pool shelters and accessories such as play equipment are not taken into account for the moment

It's important to note that this calculation model is constantly being improved (see https://github.com/laem/futureco-data/issues/97)

logement . chauffage . bois . type . b√ª.note: Figure taken from the ADEME Study on domestic wood heating, file 3_presentation.pdf, page 34.

logement . chauffage . bois . type . b√ª.description: There is no recent price for a stere of wood. The idea is to take into account the increase in rates via the inflation index.

logement . chauffage . bois . indice pri.note: Price index as of February 2023 compared to 2015 (inflation on wood similar to 2017, our reference year). Figure taken from INSEE, French industry production price index for the French market - Wood energy - Market price - Base 2015

gaz.description: Here we calculate the price of gas based on household consumption. This means including the various compulsory levies, as well as the really significant subscription in the case of gas. Please note that the gas market is largely liberalized, so the regulated tariff, which is the basis of our calculation, is no longer exclusive. We can no longer subscribe to it, but existing customers will continue to do so until 2023. In 2023, there will be two types of tariff: one indexed to the regulated tariff, which is very close to it, and completely free tariffs, often fixed for a specific period. We therefore assume that the regulated tariff remains representative of the price for an average household. Source for the list of taxes. See also: https://tarifgaz.com/tarifs

gaz . marginal HT.description: Marginal price per kWh excluding tax for a B1 package (kitchen, air and water heating: 6000kWh to 30 000kWh/year) We choose zone 2 because it seems the most representative (zone 1 has more cities, most of the metropolises, but remains an extremity and Paris is in 2). Understanding the zones. The scale of January 2023 is available on the CRE website.

gaz . marginal tax√©.valeur: TICGN avec TVA + marginal avec TVA

gaz . abonnement ATRD fixe.description: Fixed part of the transmission tariff applied by the natural gas distribution system operators to calculate the CTA, source 2023. The B1 tariff option (customer side) that we consider corresponds to the T2 tariff option (supplier side)

gaz . consommation par d√©faut.description: To calculate an estimate of the real price paid by households and to deduce the kWh, we start with an average consumption calculated via the MTE figures of the French fleet.
gaz . consommation par d√©faut.formule: parc fran√ßais . chauffage . consommation gaz moyenne

gaz . prix total.formule: part variable + abonnement avec TVA + CTA avec TVA

gaz . prix.description:
This is the factor that allows us to go from the price paid by the
household to the consumption in kWh.
gaz . prix.note:
Note that the calculation formula is of the type p = c * a + b, where p=price, c=cost, a=marginal cost including VAT, b = fixed cost

Thus, we could have a much more reliable estimate of the consumption from the price by inverting this equation

But unfortunately our estimation form only works today with a multiplication factor.

logement . vacances.question: How are you accommodated for your weekends and vacations?
logement . vacances.description:
Enter here the different types of accommodation you use for your travels (**personal reason**).

> üí° If you never go on weekends or holidays, you can click on "none" just below this question, then "Next".
logement . vacances.note:
### What do we mean by "nights away from home" in Nos Gestes Climat?

  - Hotel or bed and breakfast
  - Camping pitch
  - Youth hostel
  - Furnished rental accommodation
  - Family or friends
  - Home exchange
  - Second home

This excludes nights spent in a hotel for business reasons.

### Towards a first version

Initially, the idea is to restrict the scope of V1 to the tourism sector (excluding second homes).

The footprint of a night spent with family or friends is currently indirectly counted in the host's footprint.

For hotels and private rooms / B&Bs, we are considering a common emission factor for the time being.

In this first version, the hotel's footprint will be divided by the number of people living in the accommodation. This is a strong assumption, as it's easy to imagine that families/households don't always travel in their entirety!
Similarly, it is assumed that a family of more than 4 people will take 2 rooms. 

The number of people living in the accommodation must be included in the formula, as a night in a youth hostel is generally characterised by a single bed in a dormitory.

logement . vacances . empreinte hotel.note: ### Calculation parameters Calculating the footprint associated with hotel stays can be quite complex, given the variety of parameters in the equation, including : - **The number of nights spent in hotels per year:** It may be difficult to estimate the number of nights spent in hotels during the year, but also to differentiate between different types of accommodation. - **Number of people in the room:** How do you estimate the number of people in your room? This figure may vary from night to night, the simplest way to get an approximation is to amortize the footprint of hotel nights by the number of people in the household. - **Location:** Whether between countries or even between cities, differences in impact can appear, notably because one of the most important parameters of a hotel's footprint is its electricity mix. - **Standing:** The hotel's standing is also an important factor. A low-end hotel and a high-end hotel will not have the same footprint. To calculate the annual footprint of your hotel "consumption", and in order to simplify the answer to this question, we have chosen to ask the user only for the number of nights he spends per year in the hotel, even though the footprint may be more or less significant, depending on the starting hypotheses. ### Consistent results Using default values representative of the French population, the footprint for this calculation is 42.24 kgCO2e. The idea here is to compare this result with the result obtained from the SDES "macro" approach for the "Lodging" economic branch, which gives a footprint of 73.62 kgCO2e per inhabitant. Thus, considering only the "Hotels" sector (67% of the sector's sales), we find a value of 49 kgCO2e. The order of magnitude is similar! However, this estimate takes into account business travel. - **The number of people sharing the room:** In this model, we assume that the hotel's footprint is divided by the number of occupants. This is a strong assumption, as it's easy to imagine that families/households don't always travel in their entirety! We also assume that a family of more than 4 people will take 2 rooms, and more than 8, 3 rooms, which explains the factors 2 and 3 in the formulas.

logement . vacances . hotel . pr√©sent.question: Do you stay in hotels or B&B?

logement . vacances . empreinte hotel pa.note: ## Our assumption on the emission factor used According to the 2019 French mobility survey, 86% of French people travel in France. We therefore assume that **nights are spent in France**. ## Our data source The final pre-deployment report on the environmental display for hotels, published by ADEME in March 2020, gives an average of 9.91 kgCO2 eq/night. If we subtract the breakfast part (which accounts for 30% of the footprint), since we'd have double counting of the latter, we end up with a footprint per night of 9.91 * (1 - 30%) = 6.93 kg eqCO2. The report also splits the footprint according to hotel class. To start with, we've assumed an average footprint across all classes, but this can be implemented later. This would give : - Unclassified hotels: 4.73 kg CO2e / night - 2* hotels: 8.53 kg eqCO2 / night - 3* hotels: 8.47 kg eqCO2 / night - 4* hotels: 11.43 kg eqCO2 / night - 5* hotels: 17.11 kg eqCO2 / night For several years now, Betterfly Tourism, in partnership with ADEME (the French Environment and Energy Management Agency), has been implementing environmental labelling for hotels. It will therefore be possible to reassess the footprint with more recent data from their consolidated database. For its part, the Hotel Carbon Measurement Initiative (HCMI ), which feeds the Cornell Hotel Sustainability Benchmarking Index, provides relevant data for our use. This could be a good starting point for the day when we want to differentiate between hotel nights spent in different countries. Note that the HCMI gives an average for France of 7.7 kgCO2 eq/night, which is very close to the figure we have chosen, calculated from the ADEME benchmark. > Point publicodes : As this rule is used in other areas, such as 'logement . vacances . hotel', it is important not to include it in this area, as this would render the footprint of the overnight stay inapplicable if the hotel rule is also inapplicable.

logement . vacances . locations . pr√©se.description: üí° Declare here nights spent in furnished rentals of the Airbnb or Abritel type.

logement . vacances . locations . emprei.note: These data are taken from the Bilan des √©missions de gaz √† effet de serre du secteur du tourisme en France They represent a "top-down" approach. First, we assume that the surface areas provided by Airbnb in France are representative of seasonal rentals in the country. We then apply to these surfaces the emission factors from the Carbone base corresponding to second homes in France. Finally, a seasonal rental occupancy rate of 25% is applied. Nos Gestes Climat usually takes a bottom-up approach: we start with usage, apply the emission factors and obtain a footprint. However, the bottom-up approach is very complex to implement here: it would involve asking the user a large number of questions (surface area, heating method for seasonal rentals, etc.). The figure obtained by the top-down approach, 5.8 kg eqCO2, is entirely consistent with the rest of the data available on other types of tourist accommodation, and seems to us a good start for approximating this complex data.

logement . vacances . r√©sidence seconda.description: To calculate the seasonal factors, which depend on both the location of the second home and the season in which it is visited, we have used the degree-hour data available for each climate zone, which can be found in this table. These degree hours can be found in the appendix to the Order of 8 October 2021 modifying the calculation method and the methods for establishing the energy performance diagnosis, available here. In France, there are three climate zones: H1, the coldest zone, the north-eastern half of France. H2, a temperate zone in the west and south-west. H3, the hottest zone, the south-east of France and French overseas departments and territories. ![Climate zones France](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/RT_2005_zone_climatique-2.svg/1176px-RT_2005_zone_climatique-2.svg.png) For our calculations, we have opted for the following assumptions: - Homes located on the north-west coast, in the countryside or in towns, correspond to the average for zones H1 and H2 < 800 m√®tres d'altitude - Les logements situ√©s sur le littoral m√©diterran√©en correspondent √† la zone H3 < 400 m√®tres d'altitude - Les logements situ√©s en montagne correspondent aux zones H1 et H2 > 800 metres above sea level We have related this to the average daily degree-hours over the year, to establish the multiplication factors for the average heating degree-hours for one day, whatever the location. multiplication factors by climate zone and period](https://github.com/incubateur-ademe/nosgestesclimat/assets/55186402/c328fa42-bae6-4391-becf-a31cbaf32201)

services soci√©taux.description:
This item includes the footprint of French public services, and market services that can be considered essential to everyone's life, divided by the country's population.  

The first category "public services" includes for example the footprint of French hospitals, or justice. We consider that this footprint should be equally distributed for all citizens, because these are "republican" jobs that only democracy can make evolve, not directly by individual consumption choices 

The second category "market services" includes the telecommunications network (fiber, telephone, etc.), but also insurance and the post office. These are relatively universal services for which we do not yet have the details that would allow us to distribute the footprint according to the consumption choices of citizens.

<RavijenChartSocietaux/>
services soci√©taux.note: The model that allows us to calculate these two constants "public services" and "market services" is different from the rest of the Nos Gestes Climat model because it is called "macroscopic". It is a macroscopic reconstruction based on the volume of money exchanged in billions of ‚Ç¨ per sector. The inclusion of this macro model allows the UCS model to be hybridized. We can thus say that it is predominantly micro with a macro component. Our source for the two macro constants is the calculation of the French national footprint by the Ministry of Ecology. Here is the most recent article, which gives us an estimate of the national footprint of 8.9 tons in 2021. The figure is extrapolated with a lot of additional uncertainties compared to the figure of 9.2 tons in 2018. To understand how this model works, see this explanation page.

services soci√©taux . question rh√©toriq.question: We allocate the footprint of public (education, health...) and commercial (telecom, insurance...) services to each citizen equally.
services soci√©taux . question rh√©toriq.description: This category does not depend on your answers. The associated footprint is calculated via a macro-economic approach at the national level. Learn more about this category.

transport . avion.description: ![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1525624286412-4099c83c1bc8?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=300&q=80) The footprint of the plane is substantial. It is not necessarily more polluting *per kilometer* than a car that only moves one person, but the distance and especially the distance covered in one hour (commonly called speed), allows to change continent for a weekend. Let's also keep in mind that the average French person does not fly or does not fly much. Most of the aviation footprint is therefore concentrated on 10% or less of the French population. > For the definition of flight ranges, from short-haul to long-haul, we use this discussion from the Base Carbone forum.
transport . avion.note:
We have chosen to ask for the total number of flight hours, rather than
asking the user to fill in each of his flights via the departure and
arrival airports and the economy class. This is a possible evolution
later, see [this
simulator](https://futur.eco/simulateur/transport/avion/impact) where
part of the work is already done.

Note also that stopovers lead to additional takeoffs, which consume more
fuel than a cruising speed. This is also a parameter to take into
account later.

For a more detailed model of the aircraft's footprint, we found two
sources.

The complete algorithm of the North app, available
[here](https://github.com/tmrowco/northapp-contrib/blob/master/co2eq/flights/index.js).

The pseudo-algorithm from myclimate.org, below.

![](https://imgur.com/hIVvuIw.jpg).

transport . avion . usager.question: Have you flown at least once in the last 3 years?
transport . avion . usager.description:
We've chosen to offer you a way of counting the impact of your air travel over several years. The footprint on the climate is such that it's important to take this into account.

So, whether you fly every year or not, answer "yes" and you'll then have the option of entering your flight times over the last 3 years.

> üí° If you flew from Paris to New York in 2021 (approx. 17h return), your associated emissions (almost 2 tons) will be spread over the last 3 years.

transport . avion . court courrier.formule: heures de vol * vitesse moyenne * empreinte par km

transport . avion . court courrier . vit.note: We use the average flight speed for a Paris-Toulouse flight.

transport . avion . court courrier . emp.description:
We use the emission factor from the
`Passenger Aircraft - Short Range, 2018 - WITH drag`.

transport . avion . court courrier . heu.question: Over a year, how many hours do you travel on flights of less than 2 hours (short-haul)?
transport . avion . court courrier . heu.description:
Count the hours you spent on a plane for trips of less than 2 hours (which corresponds to flights of less than about 1000km). If you have stopovers, simply add up the times of each flight.


The suggestions are based on the minimum round trip flight time found in search engines, doubled to consider a round trip.

üí° Only count personal travel and commuting miles to your usual place of work.
For example, if you are on a work assignment in another country, this fits into your company's accounting.
transport . avion . court courrier . heu.note: The characterization "short haul" by travel time is given by the rule `short haul . max duration` = 2.17h.

transport . avion . moyen courrier . heu.question: Over a year, how many hours do you travel on flights between 2 and 6 hours (medium-haul)?
transport . avion . moyen courrier . heu.description:
Count the hours you spent in an airplane for trips between 2 hours and 6 hours (which corresponds to flights between 1000km and 3500km approximately). If you have stopovers, simply add up the times of each flight.

The suggestions are based on the minimum round trip flight time found in search engines, doubled to consider a round trip.

üí° Only count personal travel and commuting miles to your usual place of work.
For example, if you are on a work assignment in another country, this fits into your company's accounting.

transport . avion . long courrier . vite.note: We use the average flight speed of the MicMac v2.6 model, determined from [this data](http://www.abm.fr/voyager-en-avion-le-guide-du-passager/en-complement/distances-et-durees-de-vol.html).

transport . avion . long courrier . heur.question: Over a year, how many hours do you travel on flights of more than 6 hours (long-haul)?
transport . avion . long courrier . heur.description:
Count the hours you've spent in a plane for journeys of over 6 hours (corresponding to flights of over 3500km or so). If you have stopovers, simply add up the duration of each flight. 

Note that if you travelled to a distant destination in several "short" journeys, these should be taken into account in the previous questions.

Suggestions are based on the minimum round-trip flight duration found in search engines, doubled to consider a round-trip.

üí° Count only the km of personal travel and home-work travel to reach your usual place of work.
For example, if you're on a business assignment in another country, this will be included in your company's accounts.
transport . avion . long courrier . heur.note: The characterization "long haul" by the travel time is given by the rule `medium haul . max duration` = 6.48h.

transport . deux roues . entretien pond√.note: We have chosen to weight the maintenance of electric scooters by the same factor that reduces the maintenance of electric vehicles compared with combustion engines.

transport . deux roues . entretien.formule: empreinte branche . G45 * 1000000 kgCO2e/ktCO2e * 0.02 * 0.07 / ( 0.68 + 0.07 ) / nombre deux roues circulation / km annuels moyen
transport . deux roues . entretien.note:
In item G45, we prorate the motorcycle trade and repair item (2%) on the same ratio as cars to extract maintenance from this item, which also includes trade.
We divide it by the number of vehicles in circulation, then by 3000 km (the average number of km driven per vehicle) to obtain a footprint in kgCO2e / km.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.formule: empreinte du bateau * part du volume
futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. Here's our goal: to estimate the footprint of a passenger on passenger ferries such as those linking mainland France to Corsica and England. The ferry is often proposed as a serious alternative to air travel in terms of its carbon footprint, but there has never been any estimate of its climate footprint per kilometer (not by ADEME in France, nor internationally, nor in the scientific literature) that takes into account not the average passenger, but the diversity of ticket options: - passenger in car or not - passengers in cabins, seats or on the ground - the boat's leisure facilities: restaurant, bar, swimming pool, large corridors, etc. - freight loaded in trucks - boat fill rate - speed - etc We know how much greenhouse gas (GHG) a given ferry emits: all we have to do is multiply its fuel consumption by the CO2e emission factor(s) of the fuel used. But the difficulty then lies in attributing a share of these GHGs to the passenger on foot, to the passenger alone in his or her car enjoying a VIP lounge, and to the transport of goods, and so on. The calculation principle adopted here is simple: we attribute a footprint according to the volume that the ticket purchased by the passenger and the consumption choices made on board occupy on the ship. Here's the method note (~20 pages) which explains the problem we want to solve and the possibilities for making the calculation, but which remains theoretical. Then, in concrete terms, you can take an interactive and complete look at the calculation of the dynamic emission factor just below ‚¨áÔ∏è. Finally, don't hesitate to make suggestions for modifying the model, either via a pull request on github or via a simple comment on this ticket. In practice, we're doing this on the Mega Express Four type boat simply because we have fairly detailed plans of it. We expect to do the same for other ships in the future. the Mega Express Four sailing on the Mediterranean](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0e/02_Corsica_Ferries_Mega_Express_Four_(cropped\).jpg/640px-02_Corsica_Ferries_Mega_Express_Four_\(cropped\).jpg) More information on Mega Express Four* The calculation of the various surfaces is based on anSVG drawing of the ship's decks, which is then used to deduce the volumes, and is therefore one of the keys to the calculation. ### Calculation limits A bias to note would be the non-accuracy of this ferry plan and the measurements made on it. However, it seems fairly reliable for an order of magnitude, which is our aim here. Another bias is obviously the choice of what is counted as useful surface area and what is not. For example, we have excluded open-air decks, except for the swimming pool and outdoor bars. Obviously, the calculation is only strictly applicable to this boat, but we've chosen to extrapolate it as a typical boat, as we don't have the resources to model every commercial boat. See also this ticket to read and contribute to the limits of the calculation.

> ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. We use the Mega Express Four from the Corsica Ferries fleet as a control boat. It is representative of large, fast ferries with max ~2000 passengers.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . part.titre: Share of the useful volume of the boat attributed to the passenger
futureco-data . transport . ferry . part.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.valeur: empreinte totale / km par mille nautique
futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.formule: facteur vitesse * correction temps de navigation * empreinte totale moyenne
futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . km p.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . fact.formule: rapport vitesse * rapport vitesse * rapport vitesse
futureco-data . transport . ferry . fact.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. It assumes a cubic evolution of power as a function of speed.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . corr.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. The power required to propel a ship is the cube of its speed. The climate footprint per hour naturally follows this same function. But the ship is then going faster: it will emit more per hour for less time, so this factor corrects for.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . empr.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . rapp.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . vite.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . vite.formule: distance aller / dur√©e du voyage . r√©elle
futureco-data . transport . ferry . vite.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . dist.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. We don't yet calculate the actual distances crossed by boats. So adding a 30% factor will help us get closer. If you have access to a sourced average factor, please let us know.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . dur√.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. We consider that for a departure at 7pm on the ticket, and an arrival at 7am, for the calculation of speed the crossing did not last 12h but 11h, because there are 30 minutes before the ferry starts and then 30 minutes of disembarkation. Of course, this may vary depending on the company and the type of ticket (pedestrian or car boarding), but it's an order of magnitude. For short crossings of less than 3 hours, we deduct 10% of the time (also by convention), i.e. 20 minutes * 2 for 3 hours, for example.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . volu.note:
For the cabins, seats and garages, we cannot assume that they are as little filled as the "passengers" indicator gives us (1/3). 

Indeed, we assume that the maximum number of passengers is very high because we can get a lot of people in for daytime crossings. 

The average occupancy of these three other spaces should be closer to 2/3 with an aggressive yield pricing policy for the remaining seats. 

‚ö†Ô∏è This may be an overly favorable assumption that could result in an underestimate of 30% to 100%.
futureco-data . transport . ferry . volu.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model.

futureco-data . transport . ferry . volu.question: What is the useful volume of the boat?
futureco-data . transport . ferry . volu.description: > ‚ÑπÔ∏è This rule comes from the `futureco-data` model. Here, "useful volume" means the sum of all surfaces other than the boat's own infrastructure, safety, crew, etc. > The calculation of the various surfaces is based on anSVG drawing of the ship's decks, which we then use to deduce the volumes

futureco-data . transport . ferry . dist.note: The user enters the departure and arrival ports, we retrieve their coordinates and calculate the great circle distance, which is to take into account the fact that the earth is not flat.

transport . ferry . empreinte.formule: heures * futureco-data . transport . ferry . vitesse moyenne . m√©trique * futureco-data . transport . ferry . empreinte par km volume
transport . ferry . empreinte.description: The ferry model comes from Futur.eco. This model is explained in simplified form on the "Footprint per km and passenger" page, and is based on an in-depth study (see the complete methodological note) In order to simplify the assessment of the user's footprint, we propose an estimate based on travel time (in hours). We then set the other calculation parameters as such: - Cabin travel - One car on board - 2 people share cabin, car - Ferry model considered (layout, average speed): Mega Express Four

transport . ferry . usager.question: Do you take the ferry?
transport . ferry . usager.description:
Answer yes if you're taking the ferry to neighboring islands or continents (Corsica, UK, Maghreb...).

If you take cruises (long voyages where you live on the boat), also answer yes: initially, we count ferry and cruise times in the same way.

If you don't take the ferry every year, but intend to continue taking it, answer "yes" and roughly estimate the number of hours per year.

For example, for a 9h crossing (one night) every 3 years, answer `3`.

transport . ferry . empreinte moyenne ..note: According to SDES figures, around 22.9 million passengers, excluding cruise passengers, embarked and disembarked in mainland France in 2019 (2020 excluded as COVID year not representative). Nevertheless, we don't know the proportion of unique travelers, nor whether these are French travelers... Let alone the distance travelled. Ferry journeys are mainly on the Channel / North Sea, which can be approximated to "Cherbourg-Poole" journeys (8h return). We are therefore making a strong assumption here, estimating that 10 million French people travel by ferry each year, for an average duration of 8 hours.

transport . ferry . heures.question: How many hours a year do you travel by ferry or cruise?
transport . ferry . heures.description:
For the moment, we do not take into account the options that can increase or decrease the footprint of a ferry crossing: 
  - car on board
  - filling the cabin or reserving a seat
  - use of services on board (restaurant, stores)
  - and of course the speed of the boat (the faster a boat is, the more it consumes).

The calculation is made for a typical crossing.
transport . ferry . heures.note: According to SDES figures, the majority of ferry journeys are made on the Channel/North Sea, which can be approximated to "Cherbourg-Poole" journeys (8h return).

transport . m√©tro ou tram.description:
This covers all modes of urban rail transport.

![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1581262208435-41726149a759?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=500&q=60)
transport . m√©tro ou tram.formule: heures par semaine * impact par heure * commun . semaines par an

transport . m√©tro ou tram . impact par.description: We are confusing all means of urban rail transport, i.e. metro, tramway and RER.

transport . m√©tro ou tram . impact par.note: We make the (strong) assumption of an unweighted average to calculate the impact per km.
Metro, tramway, trolleybus/2018/Agglomeration of 100,000 to 250,000 inhabitants ; Base Carbone consulted on 06/12/2023
RER and transilien/2022/Ile de France ; Base Carbone consulted on 06/12/2023

transport . m√©tro ou tram . vitesse.note: Assumption of 25 km/h average speed, according to the article Les petits secrets de la RATP r√©v√©l√©s au public (RATP's little secrets revealed to the public)

transport . m√©tro ou tram . heures par.question: How many hours a week do you spend on the metro, tram or RER?

transport . mobilit√© douce.question: What are your "efficient" modes of transport?
transport . mobilit√© douce.description:
These modes of transport are often referred to as "soft" modes. This adjective does little to highlight their incredible efficiency.

With equipment weighing less than 20 kg (30 kg for cargo bikes), you can easily transport the weight of one, or even two or three people (one bike with two children on board) over short, sometimes medium, more rarely long distances. And the shopping too!

> üí° The "Small electric vehicle" category includes electric scooters, but also giropods, monowheels, hoverboards...

> Tip: Think of your cargo bike as an EV if it electrically powered, as a classic bike if it's not.

transport . mobilit√© douce . notif marc.description:
**You have ticked walking or cycling ?
Congratulations! üëè

Cycling is a super sober mode of transport: you use 15 kilos of material to move a ~70 kilo body.
As for your shoes, they're an ultra-lightweight vehicle!

üí° Note that the footprint of walking and the one for **using** the classic bicycle (not manufacturing) is considered zero.

transport . mobilit√© douce . marche.note: The walking footprint is considered to be zero.

transport . mobilit√© douce . v√©lo.note:
We consider that **use** of the muscle bike has a zero footprint.

It is always possible to attribute the footprint of excess calories, which depends on diet.

We have all the ingredients here to do it, but it's not quite that simple. Excess physical activity is also associated with much lower health risks and therefore lower health costs.

transport . mobilit√© douce . v√©lo . co.note: The footprint base does not offer a FE for conventional bicycles. Nevertheless, in 2021, bicycle manufacturer Trek published a study presenting the carbon footprint of its bicycles' production. For the most popular, the footprint is 116 kgCO2e.

transport . mobilit√© douce . v√©lo . du.note: The lifespan of a conventional bicycle is assumed to be identical to that of an EAB (this is a strong assumption, as it seems that an EAB carries more components which may wear out more) Assumption taken from HBEFA (Manual of Emission Factors for Road Transport), based on documentation in the empreinte database. Figures taken from the 2019 ADEME study "Mod√©lisation et √©valuation environnementale de produits de consommation et biens d'√©quipement"

transport . mobilit√© douce . vae.note: Electrically-assisted cargo bikes belong in the EAB category. The difference in motorization and weight, and therefore footprint, is too slight to merit a separate category.

transport . mobilit√© douce . vae . pr√©.question: Do you own an electric bike ?

transport . mobilit√© douce . vae . km.question: How many kilometers do you cover per year with your electric bike ?
transport . mobilit√© douce . vae . km.description: Tip: on an EAB, the total number of kilometers covered is displayed on the on-board monitor.

transport . mobilit√© douce . vae . dur√.note: Assumption taken from HBEFA (Manual of Emission Factors for Road Transport), based on empreinte documentation. Figures taken from the 2019 ADEME study "Mod√©lisation et √©valuation environnementale de produits de consommation et biens d'√©quipement"

transport . mobilit√© douce . autres v√©.description: Electric scooter, gyropod, electric unicycle, hoverboard...
transport . mobilit√© douce . autres v√©.note:
Small motorized vehicles are booming, driven largely by the explosion in sales of VAEs and electric scooters. But we can also find electric unicycles, gyropods, hoverboards...

The carbon database does not allow us to distinguish all categories of small motorized vehicles. 
However, as the footprint of this type of vehicle is closely linked to its weight, and as these weights are similar for all this category of vehicles,
we'll consider that the footprint of all MPVs, excluding EVs, is equivalent to that of the electric scooter.

transport . mobilit√© douce . autres v√©.question: Do you own an electric scooter, gyropod, electric unicycle, hoverboard...?
How many kilometers do you cover per year with your electric scooter, gyropod, electric unicycle, hoverboard...?

transport . mobilit√© douce . autres v√©.note: Assumption taken from HBEFA (Manual of Emission Factors for Road Transport), based on empreinte documentation. Figures taken from the 2019 ADEME study "Mod√©lisation et √©valuation environnementale de produits de consommation et biens d'√©quipement"

transport . train . impact par km.note: Different types of train have different carbon impacts per passenger per kilometre. We calculate a weighted average in proportion to the total number of kilometres travelled on each type of train at national level. Source: Transport Regulation Authority ![Passenger.km distribution](https://github.com/incubateur-ademe/nosgestesclimat/assets/55186402/4bbdf823-8e9a-4570-90da-77ff8af05b14)

transport . train . TER.note: TER - 2022 - Average traction; 27.7 gCO2e/km/person; Carbon base consulted on 19/11/2023 (SNCF data)

transport . train . intercit√©s.node: Intercit√©s - 2022 ; 8.98 gCO2e/km/personne ; Base Carbone consult√©e le 19/11/2023 (Donn√©es SNCF)

transport . train . proportion TGV.note: Figures fromthe Autorit√© de R√©gulation des Transports.

transport . train . proportion TER.formule: passagers km TER / total passagers km
transport . train . proportion TER.note: Figures fromthe Autorit√© de R√©gulation des Transports.

transport . train . km.description:
Suggestions are based on the distance as the crow flies doubled to
consider a round trip.

transport.description:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/Correspondances_Pey_Berland_ao√ªt_2016.jpg/640px-Correspondances_Pey_Berland_ao√ªt_2016.jpg)

Unsurprisingly, transport, and above all oil-based transport, accounts for a very large part of our footprint.

This category covers everything to do with getting around. We've also included uses that could be considered *leisure*, relating to vacations, such as caravans and motorhomes

transport . vacances.question: What do you own for your weekends and holidays (apart from your main vehicle)?
transport . vacances.description:
Here you can select what you need for your holidays. The "converted van" category includes converted vans and lorries. 

If you have already entered the kilometres travelled in a converted van previously, indicating "light commercial vehicle" as the main vehicle used for travel, then you can tick "none" here.

üí° If you don't own a motorhome, caravan or converted van, or if you hire them out, you can click on "none" just below this question, then "Next". Rental is not yet available in our model**.

transport . vacances . caravane.note: Excess fuel consumption is calculated for the kilometres travelled with the caravan.

transport . vacances . caravane . surcon.formule: voiture . empreinte au kilom√®tre * ratio surconsommation

transport . vacances . caravane . ratio.note:
1.2 to 1.5 l/100 km [here](https://www.lemondedupleinair.com/comment-limiter-sa-consommation-de-carburant-en-tractant-une-caravane/) which can be estimated at an overconsumption of 10 to 20%
40 to 50% [here](https://forum.lescaravaniers2.com/viewtopic.php?t=9973)
As a first approximation, we therefore consider a hypothesis of 25% overconsumption

transport . vacances . caravane . distan.question: How far do you travel per year in your caravan?
transport . vacances . caravane . distan.description:
Note that to do these caravan miles, you did them with a car: so you
must have included them in the car miles (a question you probably
already answered).

üí° This question serves us to apply the overconsumption of the towing of
your caravan to a part of your car km.
transport . vacances . caravane . distan.note: According to the French federation of campers, caravanners and motor-home owners, the average motor-home owner travels between 5,000 and 7,500 km per year ( source)

transport . vacances . caravane . constr.formule: voiture . gabarit . berline . empreinte * (caravane . poids / voiture . gabarit . berline . poids)
transport . vacances . caravane . constr.note: We extrapolate the impact of manufacturing a caravan using a weight ratio and considering "Saloon" construction data (6300 kgCO2e and 1500 kg) Source Figure 6 and Table 1 FNH-Carbone4 A caravan weight of 750 kg is assumed.

transport . vacances . caravane . dur√©e.note:
As for the motor home, a lifetime of [25 years] is considered (https://objectifpleinair.com/combien-de-temps-dure-un-camping-car/).
This assumption needs to be better sourced.

transport . vacances . caravane . pource.note: Half as many caravans were sold in France in 2021 as motorhomes. We can assume that there are half as many caravanners as motorhome owners ( source).

transport . vacances . camping car . pro.question: Do you own a motor home?

transport . vacances . camping car . con.formule: voiture . gabarit . berline . empreinte * (camping car . poids / voiture . gabarit . berline . poids)
transport . vacances . camping car . con.note: We extrapolate the impact of manufacturing a caravan based on a weight ratio and considering "Saloon" construction data (6300 kgCO2e and 1500 kg) Source Figure 6 and Table 1 FNH-Carbone4 We assume a weight of 3t for camping cars, with a rolling limit (with a B driving license) of 3.5t (leaving 500 kg for interior fittings).

transport . vacances . camping car . dur.note:
A lifetime of [25 years](https://objectifpleinair.com/combien-de-temps-dure-un-camping-car/) is considered.
This assumption needs to be better sourced

transport . vacances . camping car . km.question: How far do you travel per year in your motorhome?
transport . vacances . camping car . km.description:
Please note that these motorhome miles should not be entered in the car
miles (a question you have probably already answered), they are two
different questions.
transport . vacances . camping car . km.note: According to the French federation of campers, caravanners and motor-home owners, motor-home owners travel an average of 8,869 km per year ( source)

transport . vacances . camping car . con.question: Do you know the average consumption of your motorhome?
transport . vacances . camping car . con.note: By default, we consider a consumption of [15 l per 100 km](http://www.france-camping-car.fr/utilisation/consommation-camping-car.php)

transport . vacances . camping car . emp.formule: consommation au kilom√®tre * empreinte au litre

transport . vacances . camping car . usa.formule: camping car . km * empreinte au kilom√®tre

transport . vacances . camping car . pou.note: There are 1.4 million motorhome owners in France, 77% of whom drive a motorhome (23% a van), according to the F√©d√©ration des campeurs, caravaniers et camping-caristes

transport . vacances . van . km.question: How far do you travel by van each year?
transport . vacances . van . km.description: Please note that these van kilometres should not be entered in the car kilometers (a question you have probably already answered), as they are two different questions.
transport . vacances . van . km.note: According to the French federation of campers, caravanners and motor-home owners, a "vanlifer" travels an average of 9,310 km a year ( source)

transport . vacances . van . empreinte a.formule: consommation au kilom√®tre * empreinte au litre

transport . vacances . van . consommatio.question: Do you know the average fuel consumption of your van?
transport . vacances . van . consommatio.note: The default fuel consumption is 9 litres per 100 km

transport . vacances . van . constructio.formule: voiture . gabarit . berline . empreinte * (van . poids / voiture . gabarit . berline . poids)
transport . vacances . van . constructio.note: The impact of manufacturing a caravan is extrapolated from a ratio based on weight and considering "Saloon" construction data (6300 kgCO2e and 1500 kg) Source Figure 6 and Table 1 FNH-Carbone4 Assuming a weight of 3t for the van, the rolling limit (with a B driving licence) is 3.5t (which leaves 500 kg for the interior fittings).

transport . vacances . van . poids.note: The weight of a converted van varies between 2.6 and 3.5 tonnes (above 3.5 tonnes, the vehicle's maximum permissible weight changes to become a "heavy goods vehicle", requiring a different licence)

transport . vacances . van . dur√©e de v.note: We consider the life of a converted van to be the same as that of a motorhome.

transport . vacances . van . pourcentage.note: There are 1.4 million motorhome owners in France, 23% of whom drive a van according to the French Federation of Campers, Caravanners and Motorhome Owners (F√©d√©ration des campeurs, caravaniers et camping-caristes)

transport . voiture.description:
![](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1572312284222-ecf6d70f1907?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=400&q=80)

Today's cars in France are mainly combustion-powered (petrol, diesel), although electric vehicles are making slow progress.

However, whether electric or combustion-powered, the car remains a highly inefficient means of transport:
**On average, it's enough to move an 80kg human being in a 1200kg metal box**.

It's a bit like making lunch for 10 and then throwing away 90% of the food, or deciding to heat the whole block rather than the inside of each of the 10 houses.

Finally, it's important to take into account both the use (the kilometers traveled) and the construction of this vehicle made of over a ton of various materials.

transport . voiture . km.question: How far do you travel per year by car?
transport . voiture . km.description:
Only count kilometers for personal travel (shopping, leisure, family, etc.) and for commuting to your usual place of work.

For example, if you're on a business assignment in another department or another country, this is included in your company's accounts: don't count it here.

transport . voiture . km annuels moyen.note: Figure taken from datalab minist√®re √©cologie 2019, page 3 G1.

transport . voiture . utilisateur r√©gul.question: Do you mostly use the same car to get around?
transport . voiture . utilisateur r√©gul.description:
As opposed to the exclusive use of rental cars shared with other people the rest of the time, or the occasional use of a friend's or family car.

You don't own a car, but you still put in the miles.

Answer yes if you use the same vehicle most of the time, either as a passenger or as a driver. 

This could be the case if the vehicle belongs to a family member or close friend. Or if you systematically rent the same type of vehicle, as in the case of a subscription to a car-sharing service.

transport . voiture . notif utilsateur i.description: You drive different vehicles, so we've given you the characteristics of an "average" car.

transport . voiture . empreinte utilisat.formule: (((construction / dur√©e de vie) * facteur location) + usage) / voyageurs

transport . voiture . saisie voyageurs.question: What is the average number of passengers in the car?
transport . voiture . saisie voyageurs.description:
A car consumes roughly the same amount of fuel whether it has 1, 2 or 5 passengers on board. So travelling with several people means potentially dividing your individual footprint by 5!

ü§î But this is not an easy question: it's likely that in the course of a year you'll have gone on vacation with 3 people, taken the car every day on your own, and so on.

Try to estimate a rough average: if every day you take the car by yourself, put 1 or 1.2.
If you only drive with family or friends, put 3 or 4.

> In a future development of the simulator, we'll be able to separate the questions by type of journey: vacation, home-work, daily with a customizable number of travellers.

Of course, if you're driving yourself or taking a cab, the driver doesn't count, as he's there to help you make your journey.

transport . voiture . voyageurs.titre: Average number of passengers in the car

transport . voiture . notif minimum voya.description: The number of passengers can't be zero. At the wheel of your car, you are the first passenger.

transport . voiture . usage.formule: km * (empreinte au kilom√®tre + base au kilom√®tre)

transport . voiture . empreinte au kilom.note: For the hybrid car, we have not yet used the values in the GES balance sheet database, as they are complicated to interpret: - the "plug-in hybrid" category has a surprisingly small footprint (on a par with electric vehicles), but above all 0 combustion emissions. So it would be a petrol vehicle that doesn't use any petrol at all? [A recent topic] on the bilan-GES forum doesn't explain the inconsistency. - the difference between Prius full-hybrid and P2 full-hybrid is not explained - in these 2 categories, there is no entry-level model. The FNH-Carbone4 study could be used to calculate the footprint per km of plug-in hybrids. Here is the structuring hypothesis adopted: > Distribution of driving modes (thermal / electric) for hybrids: 50% / 50% in 2016 Note, however, the recent controversy over the footprint of plug-in hybrids, following a study by Transport & Environnement showing a real footprint incomparable to the one claimed by automakers. For the time being, therefore, we have used the calculation of the MicMac calculator, which is the basis of Nos Gestes Climat, the source of which is unfortunately inaccessible: > Hybrid: deduct 15% from the above consumption figures (source ADEME: http://www2.ademe.fr/servlet/KBaseShow?catid=13655)

transport . voiture . motorisation.question: What type of car do you use?
transport . voiture . motorisation.description: üí° **If you use more than one car (e.g. if you don't own one), choose the answer that best represents your usage.**

transport . voiture . thermique . emprei.formule: consommation au kilom√®tre * empreinte au litre
transport . voiture . thermique . emprei.note: This calculation method, rather than a gauge -> footprint per km scale, allows the user who knows the real average consumption of his car to enter it for more accuracy.

transport . voiture . thermique . consom.question: Do you know the average consumption of the car?
transport . voiture . thermique . consom.description: **üí° If you use several cars (e.g. if you don't own one), choose the answer that best represents your usage.**
transport . voiture . thermique . consom.note: Suggestions for answers are in the form of a ladle, to be specified and sourced.

transport . voiture . thermique . emprei.description:
The footprints are available in some detail on [the carbon
base](https://bilans-ges.ademe.fr/fr/basecarbone/donnees-consulter/liste-element?recherche=diesel),
here for example for "diesel". Same for "gasoline". To find them easily,
filter by unit "kgCO2e/liter" and by geography "continental France".

Note that for diesel, the FE chosen is the average between B7 diesel and
B10 diesel.

transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.question: What type of fuel does your car use?
transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.description: To help you understand the different types of fuel, this educational article is very useful. This article from the French Ministry of Ecology explains in greater detail the fuels legal in France. > Please note that while the type of fuel varies significantly in terms of climate footprint per liter, consumption in liters per 100km also varies. Be sure to enter a consumption per liter based on your actual average.
transport . voiture . thermique . carbur.note: The dominance of the diesel-gasoline combination is overwhelming . On the other hand, among new vehicles, gasoline now dominates. The emission factor associated with E85 biofuel is not representative of the environmental consequences of biofuel use. In fact, given the problems associated with land-use change and other environmental impacts linked to the cultivation of corn, for example, **biofuels** are not taken into account (the emission factor of the carbon base being particularly uncertain). See our discussions here.

transport . voiture . notif carburant.description:
Your vehicle runs on biofuel: in addition to the carbon footprint of biofuels, we need to be aware that they also have a footprint on the soil: this soil could be used to grow cereals to feed us, or serve as biodiversity refuges.
This is what we call "land-use change" here, for the purposes of biofuel production. Unfortunately, the climate impact of this land-use change is difficult to quantify and particularly uncertain.

We have chosen to include this option in the test, but it should be noted that this result **is not representative of the likely environmental consequences associated with the use of biofuels**

transport . voiture . √©lectrique . empr.note:
We make the following correspondence between our size and the data of the GES-balance database (regarding the weight of the vehicles):
  - small -> "entry level - light vehicle"
  - medium -> "mid-range - compact vehicle"
  - sedan, SUV and LCV -> "top of the range - sedan"

transport . voiture . gabarit.question: What is the size of the car?
transport . voiture . gabarit.description:
**üí° If you use more than one car (e.g., in the case of not owning one), choose the answer that is most representative of your usage.**

The heavier and taller a car is so with a strong wind grip, the more it consumes so the more it pollutes!
transport . voiture . gabarit.note: We consider the default car to be a "Sedan", as evidenced by a study conducted by AAA Data which states that "While SUVs accounted for 38% of vehicle sales in 2019, they represent only 16% of all vehicles on the road, far behind sedans, which account for 58%, or 23 million vehicles."

transport . voiture . gabarit . moyenne.description: Model above the small city car, type Megane, Golf

transport . voiture . gabarit . VUL.description: Truck type Kangoo or Partner up to Trafic and Vito

transport . voiture . gabarit . berline.description: A long car, type 308, Tesla Model 3, Audi A3

transport . voiture . consommation estim.note: The correspondence table is only indicative, and is far from being strictly based on the statistics for cars on the road in France: the main thing is for the user to enter his *real* consumption. That said, the "average" gauge is based on the average **diesel** value (most common fuel, 2x gasoline) of 6.1l/100km in 2019 from the Ministry of the Environment's transport balance sheet: source figure G3-4 page 9. TheADEME study used to extrapolate data for LCVs gives a value of 5.3l/100km for commercial vehicles. This value seems low in view of the vehicle's weight. To be more conservative, we'll stick with the "average" approach.

transport . voiture . base au kilom√®tre.titre: Maintenance and air conditioning by the kilometer

transport . voiture . entretien pond√©r√.note: Several sources agree that the maintenance of an electric vehicle is 25% lower than that of a combustion vehicle. Like this one. As for a hybrid vehicle, its maintenance is between that of an electric vehicle and that of a combustion engine vehicle. This depends on whether the electric or internal combustion engine is used. We have chosen to work on the conservative assumption of -10% maintenance costs compared with combustion vehicles.

transport . voiture . entretien.formule: ((empreinte branche . G45 * 1000000 kgCO2e/ktCO2e * 0.07) / nombre v√©hicules circulation) / transport . voiture . km annuels moyen
transport . voiture . entretien.note:
In item G45, we take the share of vehicle maintenance and repair (7%).
We divide it by the number of vehicles in circulation, then by 12,200 km (the average number of km driven per vehicle) to obtain a footprint in kgCO2e / km.

transport . voiture . climatisation.formule: (√©missions gaz fluor√©s transport / nombre v√©hicules circulation) / transport . voiture . km annuels moyen
transport . voiture . climatisation.note:
The idea here is to take into account a proportion of emissions linked to fluorinated gases from vehicle air conditioning systems 
in France via the total emissions due to these gases in the transport sector (diesel, petrol, CNG, LPG and electric cars and LCVs).

transport . voiture . climatisation . √©.titre: National emissions from air conditioning systems on cars and LCVs
transport . voiture . climatisation . √©.note: This figure comes from the SECTEN study (the benchmark report on greenhouse gas and atmospheric pollutant emissions in France). According to excel Data by greenhouse gas (GHG) substance, 2023 edition, tab "GF-UE_total", fluorinated gas emissions for the transport sector (from refrigeration and air conditioning equipment, using halocarbons or SF6), are 1374 ktCO‚ÇÇe.

transport . voiture . nombre v√©hicules.note: This figure concerns private vehicles (cars and LCVs). It is taken from INSEE statistics.
transport . voiture . nombre v√©hicules.titre: number of vehicles on the road

transport . voiture . construction.description:
![](https://i.imgur.com/uIlZcEjl.jpg)

A car is a big, big object, often weighing over a ton and a half. As a result, its construction has a significant footprint.

In particular, the construction of an electric car in the same range as a combustion engine emits more greenhouse gases. This is mainly due to the battery and its considerable weight.

Despite this, in France, over the life of the car and therefore the number of kilometers covered, the choice of an electric car is clearly better for the climate.

Better, but far from poor! In 2020, it's not just a question of comparing technical solutions, it's a question of evaluating purchases in relation to climate objectives.
transport . voiture . construction.note: We use the FNH-Carbone4 study. For the time being, we only have two sizes, the city car and the sedan. Therefore, for "medium" vehicles, LCVs, SUVs, etc., we have chosen to approximate the fuel consumption, we have chosen to approximate the footprint by weight, considering city cars and medium-sized vehicles on the one hand, and saloons, LCVs and SUVs on the other sedans, LCVs and SUVs. | Thermal weight (kg) | Electric weight (kg) | Source | |------------------------------|----------------------|-----------------------|----------------------| | Urban car | 1200 | 1500 | Carbone 4 study | | Average vehicle (M√©gane type) | 1250 | 1600 | Manufacturer's data | | Sedan | 1500 | 2000 | Etude Carbone 4 | | LCV (type Kangoo) | 1400 | 1800 | Manufacturer data | | SUV (type Audi Q3) | 1500 | 1800 | Manufacturer's data | p. 12 of the Carbone 4 study: ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107264406-3afdd980-6a43-11eb-87ad-a09681240949.png) We only take into account "production and end-of-life" and 2016 data rather than the prospective 2030 scenario. p. 57 and 58. ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107265071-1eae6c80-6a44-11eb-9b51-c2aee3bfcf3c.png) ![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107265098-2706a780-6a44-11eb-8681-7901f00e057b.png) We have chosen not to subtract "recycling credits" corresponding to emissions avoided through the use of recycled materials from the dismantling of a car, for the production of new manufactured products. We assume that the reduced footprint benefits the purchaser of the recycled product, and not the purchaser of a product that is to be recycled.

transport . voiture . construction . bar.note: Surprisingly, the sedan has a smaller footprint than the city car... We'll see if the study solves this mystery.

transport . voiture . gabarit . berline.note: Rule used to calculate the footprint of caravans and campers.
Rule used to calculate the footprint of the caravan and motorhome.

transport . voiture . v√©hicule r√©cent.question: Is your vehicle less than 10 years old?
transport . voiture . v√©hicule r√©cent.description:
To calculate the footprint of the car's construction, which should not be neglected, we use the car's age.

Be sure to answer by considering *the age of the car*, not the number of years it has been in your possession: chances are you bought it second-hand.

> If two of you use two cars, you can simply allocate one to each of you.
> If you own several cars that you use only yourself, ~~at least sell the second one~~ this case is not yet foreseen.

transport . voiture . amortissement.description: There were lively discussions about the car's depreciation. Previously, in order to discourage the purchase of new cars, a non-linear depreciation had been imagined, strongly decreasing over time, over 10 years. This non-linear depreciation had the merit of discouraging the purchase, and of making it clear to the user that a large part of the vehicle's footprint is linked to its production, and therefore to the new purchase. But this non-linear depreciation was not easy for users to understand, and missed its educational objective. In addition, it created a double discourse in Nos Gestes Climat, because in the actions proposed to car owners, we propose the purchase of an electric vehicle, which is strongly penalized if purchased new in the individual carbon footprint. Finally, there was one exception in the Nos Gestes Climat simulator: all other assets are depreciated on a straight-line basis (the construction footprint is divided by the asset's lifespan). We therefore chose to revert to straight-line depreciation over the life of the car, i.e. 19 years according to this source.

transport . voiture . dur√©e de vie.description: We consider that a private car, like a rental car, is used for an average of 10 years before being scrapped. This assumption is taken from the Empreinte database, and more specifically, the study conducted jointly by ADEME and E4T ( Bilan transversal de l'impact de l'√©lectrification par segment). ![](https://github.com/incubateur-ademe/nosgestesclimat/assets/55186402/0b35e469-e42e-438f-8b34-9c127d606747)

transport . voiture . facteur location.note: The impact of the construction is attributed to the user on a pro rata basis in relation to the number of kilometers driven by the car over a year.
